chemistry between and c being collected for further purification it may be shaken with hot lime water the oily layer separated dried
chemistry dried with calcium chloride and fractionated the fraction boiling between and c only being collected it may be synthesized from isobutanol

chemistry of physical science is the study of the composition properties and behavior of matter chemistry is concerned with atoms and their
chemistry their interactions with other atoms and particularly with the properties of chemical bonds chemistry is also concerned with the interactions between
chemistry between atoms or groups of atoms and various forms of energy e g photochemical reactions changes in phases of matter separation
chemistry separation of mixtures properties of polymers etc chemistry is sometimes called the central science because it bridges other natural sciences like
chemistry like physics geology and biology with each other chemistry is a branch of physical science but distinct from physics the word

chemistry the definition of chemistry has changed over time as new discoveries and theories add to the functionality of the science the
chemistry the term chymistry in the view of noted scientist robert boyle in meant the subject of the material principles of mixed
chemistry mixed bodies in chymistry meant a scientific art by which one learns to dissolve bodies and draw from them the different
chemistry different substances on their composition and how to unite them again and exalt them to a higher perfection this definition was

chemistry art of resolving mixed compound or aggregate bodies into their principles and of composing such bodies from those principles in jean
chemistry jean baptiste dumas considered the word chemistry to refer to the science concerned with the laws and effects of molecular forces
chemistry forces this definition further evolved until in it came to mean the science of substances their structure their properties and the
chemistry the reactions that change them into other substances a characterization accepted by linus pauling more recently in the definition of chemistry

chemistry the current model of atomic structure is the quantum mechanical model traditional chemistry starts with the study of elementary particles atoms

chemistry and a great deal of experimental as well as applied industrial chemistry is done without it a chemical reaction is a

chemistry related to that of chemical substance a chemical element is specifically a pure substance which is composed of a single type

chemistry this number is known as the atomic number of the element for example all atoms with protons in their nuclei are

chemistry by atomic number are also available a compound is a pure chemical substance that consists of two or more elements combined

chemistry the ratio of two to one with the oxygen atom between the two hydrogen atoms and an angle of between them

chemistry substance but it may be called a chemical most of the substances we encounter in our daily life are some kind
chemistry kind of mixture for example air alloys biomass etc nomenclature of substances is a critical part of the language of chemistry
chemistry chemistry generally it refers to a system for naming chemical compounds earlier in the history of chemistry substances were given name
chemistry name by their discoverer which often led to some confusion and difficulty however today the iupac system of chemical nomenclature allows
chemistry allows chemists to specify by name specific compounds amongst the vast variety of possible chemicals the standard nomenclature of chemical substances
chemistry substances is set by the international union of pure and applied chemistry iupac there are well defined systems in place for

chemistry the inorganic nomenclature system in addition the chemical abstracts service has devised a method to index chemical substances in this scheme
chemistry scheme each chemical substance is identifiable by a number known as its cas registry number a molecule is the smallest indivisible

chemistry undergo a certain set of chemical reactions with other substances however this definition only works well for substances that are composed

chemistry together by covalent bonds such that the structure is electrically neutral and all valence electrons are paired with other electrons either
chemistry either in bonds or in lone pairs thus molecules exist as electrically neutral units unlike ions when this rule is broken
chemistry broken giving the molecule a charge the result is sometimes named a molecular ion or a polyatomic ion however the discrete

chemistry such as a directed beam in a vacuum in a mass spectrograph charged polyatomic collections residing in solids for example common

chemistry alcohol sugar gasoline and the various pharmaceuticals however not all substances or chemical compounds consist of discrete molecules and indeed most

chemistry article mole unit the mole is a unit of measurement that denotes an amount of substance also called chemical amount specifically
chemistry specifically it is the amount of a substance that contains as many elementary entities atoms molecules or ions as there are
chemistry are atoms in kilogram or grams of carbon where the carbon atoms are unbound at rest and in their ground state
chemistry state the number of entities per mole is known as the avogadro constant and is determined empirically the currently accepted value
chemistry value is mol codata one way to understand the meaning of the term mole is to compare and contrast it to
chemistry to terms such as dozen just as one dozen eggs contains individual eggs one mole contains atoms molecules or other particles
chemistry particles the term is used because it is much easier to say for example mole of carbon than it is to
chemistry to say carbon atoms and because moles of chemicals represent a scale that is easy to experience the amount of substance
chemistry substance of a solute per volume of is known as amount of substance concentration or molarity for short molarity is the
chemistry the quantity most commonly used to express the concentration of a solution in the chemical laboratory the most commonly used units

chemistry structure of potassium chloride kcl a salt which is formed due to the attraction of k cations and cl anions note
chemistry note how the overall charge of the ionic compound is zero main article ion an ion is a charged species an
chemistry an atom or a molecule that has lost or gained one or more electrons when an atom loses an electron and
chemistry and thus has more protons than electrons the atom is a positively charged ion or cation when an atom gains an
chemistry an electron and thus has more electrons than protons the atom is a negatively charged ion or anion cations and anions
chemistry anions can form a crystalline lattice of neutral salts such as the na and cl ions forming sodium chloride or nacl
chemistry nacl examples of polyatomic ions that do not split up during acid base reactions are hydroxide oh and phosphate po ions
chemistry ions in the gaseous phase are often known as plasma atoms sticking together in molecules or crystals are said to be
chemistry be bonded with one another a chemical bond may be visualized as the multipole balance between the positive charges in the
chemistry the nuclei and the negative charges oscillating about them more than simple attraction and repulsion the energies and distributions characterize the
chemistry the availability of an electron to bond to another atom a chemical bond can be a covalent bond an ionic bond
chemistry bond a hydrogen bond or just because of van der waals force each of these kinds of bonds is ascribed to
chemistry to some potential these potentials create the interactions which hold atoms together in molecules or crystals in many simple compounds valence
chemistry valence bond theory the valence shell electron pair repulsion model vsepr and the concept of oxidation number can be used to
chemistry to explain molecular structure and composition an ionic bond is formed when a metal loses one or more of its electrons
chemistry electrons becoming a positively charged cation and the electrons are then gained by the non metal atom becoming a negatively charged
chemistry charged anion the two oppositely charged ions attract one another and the ionic bond is the electrostatic force of attraction between
chemistry between them for example sodium na a metal loses one electron to become an na cation while chlorine cl a non
chemistry non metal gains this electron to become cl the ions are held together due to electrostatic attraction and that compound sodium
chemistry sodium chloride nacl or common table salt is formed in the methane molecule ch the carbon atom shares a pair of
chemistry of valence electrons with each of the four hydrogen atoms thus the octet rule is satisfied for c atom it has
chemistry has eight electrons in its valence shell and the duet rule is satisfied for the h atoms they have two electrons
chemistry electrons in their valence shells when a chemical substance is transformed as a result of its interaction with another substance or
chemistry or with energy a chemical reaction is said to have occurred a chemical reaction is therefore a concept related to the
chemistry the reaction of a substance when it comes in close contact with another whether as a mixture or a solution exposure
chemistry exposure to some form of energy or both it results in some energy exchange between the constituents of the reaction as
chemistry as well with the system environment which may be designed vessels which are often laboratory glassware chemical reactions can result in
chemistry in the formation or dissociation of molecules that is molecules breaking apart to form two or more smaller molecules or rearrangement
chemistry rearrangement of atoms within or across molecules chemical reactions usually involve the making or breaking of chemical bonds oxidation reduction dissociation
chemistry dissociation acid base neutralization and molecular rearrangement are some of the commonly used kinds of chemical reactions a chemical reaction can
chemistry can be symbolically depicted through a chemical equation while in a non nuclear chemical reaction the number and kind of atoms
chemistry atoms on both sides of the equation are equal for a nuclear reaction this holds true only for the nuclear particles
chemistry particles viz protons and neutrons the sequence of steps in which the reorganization of chemical bonds may be taking place in

chemistry in a number of steps each of which may have a different speed many reaction intermediates with variable stability can thus
chemistry thus be envisaged during the course of a reaction reaction mechanisms are proposed to explain the kinetics and the relative product

chemistry oxidant removes electrons from another substance similarly substances that have the ability to reduce other substances are said to be reductive
chemistry reductive and are known as reducing agents reductants or reducers a reductant transfers electrons to another substance and is thus oxidized
chemistry oxidized itself and because it donates electrons it is also called an electron donor oxidation and reduction properly refer to a
chemistry a change in oxidation number the actual transfer of electrons may never occur thus oxidation is better defined as an increase

chemistry such as chemical composition remain unchanged over time energy main article energy in the context of chemistry energy is an attribute
chemistry attribute of a substance as a consequence of its atomic molecular or aggregate structure since a chemical transformation is accompanied by
chemistry by a change in one or more of these kinds of structures it is invariably accompanied by an increase or decrease
chemistry decrease of energy of the substances involved some energy is transferred between the surroundings and the reactants of the reaction in
chemistry in the form of heat or light thus the products of a reaction may have more or less energy than the
chemistry the reactants a reaction is said to be exergonic if the final state is lower on the energy scale than the
chemistry the initial state in the case of endergonic reactions the situation is the reverse a reaction is said to be exothermic
chemistry exothermic if the reaction releases heat to the surroundings in the case of endothermic reactions the reaction absorbs heat from the
chemistry the surroundings chemical reactions are invariably not possible unless the reactants surmount an energy barrier known as the activation energy the
chemistry the speed of a chemical reaction at given temperature t is related to the activation energy e by the boltzmann s

chemistry to e at the given temperature t this exponential dependence of a reaction rate on temperature is known as the arrhenius

computers uses data striping on the remaining drives level is level with block level striping level uses block level and parity data
computers data striping ram random access memory memory in which each element can be individually addressed and accessed with the same speed

computers so called supervised training sessions the model used those features to label by category the varied examples of objects found in
computers in digital photographs of street scenes buildings cars motorcycles airplanes faces pedestrians roads skies trees and leaves the photographs derive from
computers from a street scene database compiled by bileschi compared to traditional computer vision systems the biological model was surprisingly versatile traditional
computers traditional systems are engineered for specific object classes for instance systems engineered to detect faces or recognize textures are poor at
computers at detecting cars in the biological model the same algorithm can learn to detect widely different types of objects to test
computers test the model the team presented full street scenes consisting of previously unseen examples from the street scene database the model
computers model scanned the scene and based on its supervised training recognized the objects in the scene the upshot is that the
computers the model learned from examples which according to poggio is a hallmark of artificial intelligence modeling object recognition teaching a computer
computers computer how to recognize objects has been exceedingly difficult because a computer model has two paradoxical goals it needs to create
computers create a representation for a particular object that is very specific such as a horse as opposed to a cow or
computers or a unicorn at the same time the representation must be sufficiently invariant so as to discard meaningless changes in pose
computers pose illumination size position and many other variations in appearances even a child s brain handles these contradictory tasks easily in
computers in rapid object recognition pixel like information enters from the retina and passes in a fast feed forward bottom up sweep
computers sweep through the hierarchical architecture of the visual cortex what makes the poggio lab s model so innovative and powerful is
computers is that computationally speaking it mimics the brain s own hierarchy specifically the layers within the model replicate the way neurons
computers neurons process input and output stimuli according to neural recordings in physiological labs like the brain the model alternates several times
computers times between computations that help build an object representation that is increasingly invariant to changes in appearances of an object in
computers in the visual field and computations that help build an object representation that is increasingly complex and specific to a given
computers given object the model s success validates work in physiology labs that have measured the tuning properties of neurons throughout visual
computers visual cortex by necessity most of those experiments are made with simplistic artificial stimuli such as gratings bars and line drawings
computers drawings that bear little resemblance to real world images we put together a system that mimics as closely as possible how
computers how cortical cells respond to simple stimuli like the ones that are used in the physiology lab said serre the fact
computers fact that this system seems to work on realistic street scene images is a concept proof that the activity of neurons
computers neurons as measured in the lab is sufficient to explain how brains can perform complex recognition tasks making it more useful
computers useful the model used in the street scene application mimics only the computations the brain uses for rapid object recognition the
computers the lab is now elaborating the model to include the brain s feedback loops from the cognitive centers this slower form
computers form of object recognition provides time for context and reflection such as if i see a car it must be on
computers on the road not in the sky giving the model the ability to recognize such semantic features will empower it for
computers for broader applications including managing seemingly insurmountable amounts of data work tasks or even email the team is also working on
computers on a model for recognizing motions and actions such as walking or talking which could be used to filter videos for
computers for anomalous behaviors or for smarter movie editing the street scene database is freely available at center for biological and computational

computers hand to recognize a particular type of object such as a car a computer needs a template or computational representation specific
computers specific to that particular object such a template enables the computer to distinguish a car from objects in other classes noncars
computers noncars yet this representation must be sufficiently flexible to include all types of cars no matter how varied in appearance at
computers at different angles positions and poses and under different lighting conditions you want to be able to recognize an object anywhere
computers anywhere in the field of vision irrespective of where it is and irrespective of its size says serre yet if you
computers you analyze images just by their patterns of light and dark pixels then two portrait images of different people can end
computers end up looking more similar than two images of the same person taken from different angles the most effective method for
computers for getting around such problems is to train a learning algorithm on a set of images and allow it to extract
computers extract the features they have in common two wheels aligned with the road could signal a car for example serre and
computers and poggio believe that the human vision system uses a similar approach but one that depends on a hierarchy of successive
computers successive layers in the visual cortex the first layers of the cortex detect an object s simpler features such as edges
computers edges and higher layers integrate that information to form our perception of the object as a whole artificial intelligence wikipedia the
computers the free encyclopedia artificial intelligence from wikipedia the free encyclopedia redirected from ai jump to navigation search artificial intelligence portal honda
computers honda s humanoid robot asimo ai redirects here for other uses of ai and artificial intelligence see ai disambiguation the term
computers term artificial intelligence ai was first used by john mccarthy who considers it to mean the science and engineering of making
computers making intelligent machines it can also refer to intelligence as exhibited by an artificial man made non natural manufactured entity the
computers the terms strong and weak ai can be used to narrow the definition for classifying such systems ai is studied in
computers in overlapping fields of computer science psychology and engineering dealing with intelligent behavior learning and adaptation in machines generally assumed to
computers to be computers research in ai is concerned with producing machines to automate tasks requiring intelligent behavior examples include control planning
computers planning and scheduling the ability to answer diagnostic and consumer questions handwriting natural language speech and facial recognition as such the
computers the study of ai has also become an engineering discipline focused on providing solutions to real life problems knowledge mining software
computers software applications strategy games like computer chess and other video games contents schools of thought history challenge amp prize ai in

computers roughly into two schools of thought conventional ai and computational intelligence ci citation needed conventional ai mostly involves methods now classified
computers classified as machine learning characterized by formalism and statistical analysis this is also known as symbolic ai logical ai neat ai
computers ai and good old fashioned artificial intelligence gofai also see semantics methods include expert systems apply reasoning capabilities to reach a
computers a conclusion an expert system can process large amounts of known information and provide conclusions based on them case based reasoning
computers reasoning stores a set of problems and answers in an organized data structure called cases a case based reasoning system upon
computers upon being presented with a problem finds a case in its knowledge base that is most closely related to the new
computers new problem and presents its solutions as an output with suitable modifications bayesian networks behavior based ai a modular method building
computers building ai systems by hand computational intelligence involves iterative development or learning e g parameter tuning e g in connectionist systems
computers systems learning is based on empirical data and is associated with non symbolic ai scruffy ai and soft computing methods mainly
computers mainly include neural networks systems with very strong pattern recognition capabilities fuzzy systems techniques for reasoning under uncertainty have been widely
computers widely used in modern industrial and consumer product control systems evolutionary computation applies biologically inspired concepts such as populations mutation and
computers and survival of the fittest to generate increasingly better solutions to the problem these methods most notably divide into evolutionary algorithms
computers algorithms e g genetic algorithms and swarm intelligence e g ant algorithms with hybrid intelligent systems attempts are made to combine
computers combine these two groups expert inference rules can be generated through neural network or production rules from statistical learning such as
computers as in act r it is thought that the human brain uses multiple techniques to both formulate and cross check results
computers results thus systems integration is seen as promising and perhaps necessary for true ai edit history main article history of artificial
computers artificial intelligence the field of artificial intelligence truly dawned in the s since then there have been many achievements in the
computers the history of artificial intelligence some of the more notable moments include alan turing introduces the turing test to test of
computers of a machine s capability to perform human like conversation the first working ai programs were to run on the ferranti

computers ai vs weak ai debate can a man made artifact be conscious is still a hot topic amongst ai philosophers this
computers this involves philosophy of mind and the mind body problem most notably roger penrose in his book the emperor s new
computers new mind and john searle with his chinese room thought experiment argue that true consciousness cannot be achieved by formal logic
computers logic systems while douglas hofstadter in g del escher bach and daniel dennett in consciousness explained argue in favour of functionalism
computers functionalism in many strong ai supporters opinion artificial consciousness is considered as the holy grail of artificial intelligence edsger dijkstra famously
computers famously opined that the debate had little importance the question of whether a computer can think is no more interesting than
computers than the question of whether a submarine can swim epistemology the study of knowledge also makes contact with ai as engineers

computers science which aims to create it major ai textbooks define the field as the study and design of intelligent agents where
computers where an intelligent agent is a system that perceives its environment and actions which maximize its chances of success john mccarthy
computers mccarthy who coined the term in defines it as the science and engineering of making intelligent machines the field was founded
computers founded on the claim that a central property of human beings intelligence the sapience of homo sapiens can be so precisely
computers precisely described that it can be simulated by a machine this raises philosophical issues about the nature of the mind and
computers and limits of scientific hubris issues which have been addressed by myth fiction and philosophy since antiquity artificial intelligence has been
computers been the subject of breathtaking optimism has suffered stunning setbacks and today has become an essential part of the technology industry
computers industry providing the heavy lifting for many of the most difficult problems in computer science ai research is highly technical and
computers and specialized so much so that some critics decry the fragmentation of the field subfields of ai are organized around particular
computers particular problems the application of particular tools and around longstanding theoretical differences of opinion the central problems of ai include such
computers such traits as reasoning knowledge planning learning communication perception and the ability to move and manipulate objects general intelligence or strong
computers strong ai is still a long term goal of some research while many researchers no longer believe that this is possible
computers possible the field of modern ai research was founded at a conference on the campus of dartmouth college in the summer
computers summer of the attendees would become the leaders of ai research for many decades especially john mccarthy marvin minsky allen newell
computers newell and herbert simon who founded ai laboratories at mit cmu and stanford they and their students wrote programs that were
computers were to most people simply astonishing computers were solving word problems in algebra proving logical theorems and speaking english by the
computers the middle s their research was heavily funded by the u s department of defense and those involved made these predictions
computers predictions h a simon m achines will be capable within twenty years of doing any work a man can do marvin
computers marvin minsky within a generation the problem of creating artificial intelligence will substantially be solved they had failed to recognize the
computers the difficulty of some of the problems they faced in in response to the criticism of england s sir james lighthill
computers lighthill and ongoing pressure from congress to fund more productive projects the u s and british governments cut off all undirected
computers undirected exploratory research in ai leading to the first ai winter in the early s ai research was revived by the
computers the commercial success of expert systems a form of ai program that simulated the knowledge and analytical skills of one or
computers or more human experts by the market for ai had reached over a billion dollars and governments started funding again a
computers a few years later beginning with the collapse of the lisp machine market in ai once again fell into disrepute and
computers and a second longer lasting ai winter began in the s and early st century ai achieved its greatest successes albeit
computers albeit somewhat behind the scenes artificial intelligence is used for logistics data mining medical diagnosis and many other areas throughout the
computers the technology industry the success was due to several factors the incredible power of computers today see moore s law a
computers a greater emphasis on solving specific subproblems the creation of new ties between ai and other fields working on similar problems
computers problems and above all a new commitment by researchers to solid mathematical methods and rigorous scientific standards artificial intelligence by claiming
computers claiming to be able to recreate the capabilities of the human mind is both a challenge and an inspiration for philosophy
computers philosophy are there limits to how intelligent machines can be is there an essential difference between human intelligence and artificial intelligence
computers intelligence can a machine have a mind and consciousness a few of the most influential answers to these questions are given
computers given below turing s polite convention if a machine acts as intelligently as a human being then it is as intelligent
computers intelligent as a human being alan turing theorized that ultimately we can only judge the intelligence of a machine based on
computers on its behavior this theory forms the basis of the turing test the dartmouth proposal every aspect of learning or any
computers any other feature of intelligence can be so precisely described that a machine can be made to simulate it this assertion
computers assertion was printed in the proposal for the dartmouth conference of and represents the position of most working ai researchers newell
computers newell and simon s physical symbol system hypothesis a physical symbol system has the necessary and sufficient means of general intelligent
computers intelligent action this statement claims that the essence of intelligence is symbol manipulation hubert dreyfus argued that on the contrary human
computers human expertise depends on unconscious instinct rather than conscious symbol manipulation and on having a feel for the situation rather than
computers than explicit symbolic knowledge g del s incompleteness theorem a formal system such as a computer program can not prove all
computers all true statements roger penrose is among those who claim that g del s theorem limits what machines can do searle
computers searle s strong ai hypothesis the appropriately programmed computer with the right inputs and outputs would thereby have a mind in
computers in exactly the same sense human beings have minds searle counters this assertion with his chinese room argument which asks us
computers us to look inside the computer and try to find where the mind might be the artificial brain argument the brain
computers brain can be simulated hans moravec ray kurzweil and others have argued that it is technologically feasible to copy the brain
computers brain directly into hardware and software and that such a simulation will be essentially identical to the original ai research in
computers in the st century ai research has become highly specialized and technical deeply divided into subfields that often fail to communicate
computers communicate with each other subfields have grown up around particular institutions the work of individual researchers the solution of specific problems
computers problems longstanding differences of opinion about how ai should be done and the application of widely differing tools deduction reasoning problem
computers problem solving early ai researchers developed algorithms that imitated the step by step reasoning that human beings use when they solve
computers solve puzzles play board games or make logical deductions by the late s and s ai research had also developed highly
computers highly successful methods for dealing with uncertain or incomplete information employing concepts from probability and economics for difficult problems most of
computers of these algorithms can require enormous computational resources most experience a combinatorial explosion the amount of memory or computer time required
computers required becomes astronomical when the problem goes beyond a certain size the search for more efficient problem solving algorithms is a
computers a high priority for ai research human beings solve most of their problems using fast intuitive judgments rather than the conscious
computers conscious step by step deduction that early ai research was able to model ai has made some progress at imitating this
computers this kind of sub symbolic problem solving embodied approaches emphasize the importance of sensorimotor skills to higher reasoning neural net research
computers research attempts to simulate the structures inside human and animal brains that gives rise to this skill knowledge representation main articles
computers articles knowledge representation and commonsense knowledge knowledge representation and knowledge engineering are central to ai research many of the problems machines
computers machines are expected to solve will require extensive knowledge about the world among the things that ai needs to represent are
computers are objects properties categories and relations between objects situations events states and time causes and effects knowledge about knowledge what we
computers we know about what other people know and many other less well researched domains a complete representation of what exists is
computers is an ontology borrowing a word from traditional philosophy of which the most general are called upper ontologies among the most
computers most difficult problems in knowledge representation are default reasoning and the qualification problem many of the things people know take the
computers the form of working assumptions for example if a bird comes up in conversation people typically picture an animal that is
computers is fist sized sings and flies none of these things is true about all birds john mccarthy identified this problem in
computers in as the qualification problem for any commonsense rule that ai researchers care to represent there tend to be a huge
computers huge number of exceptions almost nothing is simply true or false in the way that abstract logic requires ai research has
computers has explored a number of solutions to this problem the breadth of commonsense knowledge the number of atomic facts that the
computers the average person knows is astronomical research projects that attempt to build a complete knowledge base of commonsense knowledge e g
computers g cyc require enormous amounts of laborious ontological engineering they must be built by hand one complicated concept at a time
computers time a major goal is to have the computer understand enough concepts to be able to learn by reading from sources
computers sources like the internet and thus be able to add to its own ontology the subsymbolic form of some commonsense knowledge
computers knowledge much of what people know isn t represented as facts or statements that they could actually say out loud for
computers for example a chess master will avoid a particular chess position because it feels too exposed or an art critic can
computers can take one look at a statue and instantly realize that it is a fake these are intuitions or tendencies that
computers that are represented in the brain non consciously and sub symbolically knowledge like this informs supports and provides a context for
computers for symbolic conscious knowledge as with the related problem of sub symbolic reasoning it is hoped that situated ai or computational
computers computational intelligence will provide ways to represent this kind of knowledge planning main article automated planning and scheduling intelligent agents must
computers must be able to set goals and achieve them they need a way to visualize the future they must have a
computers a representation of the state of the world and be able to make predictions about how their actions will change it
computers it and be able to make choices that maximize the utility or value of the available choices in some planning problems
computers problems the agent can assume that it is the only thing acting on the world and it can be certain what
computers what the consequences of its actions may be however if this is not true it must periodically check if the world
computers world matches its predictions and it must change its plan as this becomes necessary requiring the agent to reason under uncertainty
computers uncertainty multi agent planning uses the cooperation and competition of many agents to achieve a given goal emergent behavior such as
computers as this is used by evolutionary algorithms and swarm intelligence learning main article machine learning machine learning has been central to
computers to ai research from the beginning unsupervised learning is the ability to find patterns in a stream of input supervised learning
computers learning includes both classification be able to determine what category something belongs in after seeing a number of examples of things
computers things from several categories and regression given a set of numerical input output examples discover a continuous function that would generate
computers generate the outputs from the inputs in reinforcement learning the agent is rewarded for good responses and punished for bad ones
computers ones these can be analyzed in terms of decision theory using concepts like utility the mathematical analysis of machine learning algorithms
computers algorithms and their performance is a branch of theoretical computer science known as computational learning theory natural language processing main article
computers article natural language processing natural language processing gives machines the ability to read and understand the languages that the human beings
computers beings speak many researchers hope that a sufficiently powerful natural language processing system would be able to acquire knowledge on its
computers its own by reading the existing text available over the internet some straightforward applications of natural language processing include information retrieval
computers retrieval or text mining and machine translation motion and manipulation asimo uses sensors and intelligent algorithms to avoid obstacles and navigate
computers navigate stairs main article robotics the field of robotics is closely related to ai intelligence is required for robots to be
computers be able to handle such tasks as object manipulation and navigation with sub problems of localization knowing where you are mapping
computers mapping learning what is around you and motion planning figuring out how to get there perception main articles machine perception computer
computers computer vision and speech recognition machine perception is the ability to use input from sensors such as cameras microphones sonar and
computers and others more exotic to deduce aspects of the world computer vision is the ability to analyze visual input a few
computers few selected subproblems are speech recognition facial recognition and object recognition social intelligence main article affective computing kismet a robot with
computers with rudimentary social skills emotion and social skills play two roles for an intelligent agent it must be able to predict
computers predict the actions of others by understanding their motives and emotional states this involves elements of game theory decision theory as
computers as well as the ability to model human emotions and the perceptual skills to detect emotions for good human computer interaction
computers interaction an intelligent machine also needs to display emotions at the very least it must appear polite and sensitive to the
computers the humans it interacts with at best it should have normal emotions itself creativity main article computational creativity topio a robot
computers robot that can play ping pong developed by tosy a sub field of ai addresses creativity both theoretically from a philosophical
computers philosophical and psychological perspective and practically via specific implementations of systems that generate outputs that can be considered creative general intelligence
computers intelligence main articles strong ai and ai complete most researchers hope that their work will eventually be incorporated into a machine
computers machine with general intelligence known as strong ai combining all the skills above and exceeding human abilities at most or all
computers all of them a few believe that anthropomorphic features like artificial consciousness or an artificial brain may be required for such
computers such a project many of the problems above are considered ai complete to solve one problem you must solve them all
computers all for example even a straightforward specific task like machine translation requires that the machine the author s argument reason know
computers know what is being talked about knowledge and faithfully reproduce the author s intention social intelligence machine translation therefore is believed
computers believed to be ai complete it may require strong ai to be done as well as humans can do it approaches
computers approaches to ai there is no established unifying theory or paradigm that guides ai research researchers disagree about many issues a
computers a few of the most long standing questions that have remained unanswered are these should artificial intelligence simulate natural intelligence by
computers by studying psychology or neurology or is human biology as irrelevant to ai research as bird biology is to aeronautical engineering
computers engineering can intelligent behavior be described using simple elegant principles such as logic or optimization or does it necessarily require solving
computers solving a large number of completely unrelated problems can intelligence be reproduced using high level symbols similar to words and ideas
computers ideas or does it require sub symbolic processing cybernetics and brain simulation main articles cybernetics and computational neuroscience the human brain
computers brain provides inspiration for artificial intelligence researchers however there is no consensus on how closely it should be simulated in the
computers the s and s a number of researchers explored the connection between neurology information theory and cybernetics some of them built
computers built machines that used electronic networks to exhibit rudimentary intelligence such as w grey walter s turtles and the johns hopkins
computers hopkins beast many of these researchers gathered for meetings of the teleological society at princeton university and the ratio club in
computers in england by this approach was largely abandoned although elements of it would be revived in the s traditional symbolic ai
computers ai main article good old fashioned artificial intelligence when access to digital computers became possible in the middle s ai research
computers research began to explore the possibility that human intelligence could be reduced to symbol manipulation the research was centered in three
computers three institutions cmu stanford and mit and each one developed its own style of research john haugeland named these approaches to
computers to ai good old fashioned ai or gofai cognitive simulation economist herbert simon and alan newell studied human problem solving skills
computers skills and attempted to formalize them and their work laid the foundations of the field of artificial intelligence as well as
computers as cognitive science operations research and management science their research team performed psychological experiments to demonstrate the similarities between human problem
computers problem solving and the programs such as their general problem solver they were developing this tradition centered at carnegie mellon university
computers university would eventually culminate in the development of the soar architecture in the middle s logical ai unlike newell and simon
computers simon john mccarthy felt that machines did not need to simulate human thought but should instead try to find the essence
computers essence of abstract reasoning and problem solving regardless of whether people used the same algorithms his laboratory at stanford sail focused
computers focused on using formal logic to solve a wide variety of problems including knowledge representation planning and learning logic was also
computers also focus of the work at the university of edinburgh and elsewhere in europe which led to the development of the
computers the language prolog and the science of logic scruffy symbolic ai researchers at mit such as marvin minsky and seymour papert
computers papert found that solving difficult problems in vision and natural language processing required ad hoc solutions they argued that there was
computers was no simple and general principle like logic that would capture all the aspects of intelligent behavior roger schank described their
computers their anti logic approaches as scruffy as opposed to the neat paradigms at cmu and stanford commonsense knowledge bases such as
computers as doug lenat s cyc are an example of scruffy ai since they must be built by hand one complicated concept
computers concept at a time knowledge based ai when computers with large memories became available around researchers from all three traditions began
computers began to build knowledge into ai applications this knowledge revolution led to the development and deployment of expert systems introduced by
computers by edward feigenbaum the first truly successful form of ai software the knowledge revolution was also driven by the realization that
computers that enormous amounts of knowledge would be required by many simple ai applications sub symbolic ai during the s symbolic approaches
computers approaches had achieved great success at simulating high level thinking in small demonstration programs approaches based on cybernetics or neural networks
computers networks were abandoned or pushed into the background by the s however progress in symbolic ai seemed to stall and many
computers many believed that symbolic systems would never be able to imitate all the processes of human cognition especially perception robotics learning
computers learning and pattern recognition a number of researchers began to look into sub symbolic approaches to specific ai problems bottom up
computers up embodied situated behavior based or nouvelle ai researchers from the related field of robotics such as rodney brooks rejected symbolic
computers symbolic ai and focused on the basic engineering problems that would allow robots to move and survive their work revived the
computers the non symbolic viewpoint of the early cybernetics researchers of the s and reintroduced the use of control theory in ai
computers ai these approaches are also conceptually related to the embodied mind thesis computational intelligence interest in neural networks and connectionism was
computers was revived by david rumelhart and others in the middle s these and other sub symbolic approaches such as fuzzy systems
computers systems and evolutionary computation are now studied collectively by the emerging discipline of computational intelligence statistical ai in the s ai
computers ai researchers developed sophisticated mathematical tools to solve specific subproblems these tools are truly scientific in the sense that their results
computers results are both measurable and verifiable and they have been responsible for many of ai s recent successes the shared mathematical
computers mathematical language has also permitted a high level of collaboration with more established fields like mathematics economics or operations research russell
computers russell norvig describe this movement as nothing less than a revolution and the victory of the neats integrating the approaches intelligent
computers intelligent agent paradigm an intelligent agent is a system that perceives its environment and actions which maximizes its chances of success
computers success the simplest intelligent agents are programs that solve specific problems the most complicated intelligent agents are rational thinking human beings
computers beings the paradigm gives researchers license to study isolated problems and find solutions that are both verifiable and useful without agreeing
computers agreeing on one single approach an agent that solves a specific problem can use any approach that works some agents are
computers are symbolic and logical some are sub symbolic neural networks and others may use new approaches the paradigm also gives researchers
computers researchers a common language to communicate with other fields such as decision theory and economics that also use concepts of abstract
computers abstract agents the intelligent agent paradigm became widely accepted during the s an agent architecture or cognitive architecture researchers have designed
computers designed systems to build intelligent systems out of interacting intelligent agents in a multi agent system a system with both symbolic
computers symbolic and sub symbolic components is a hybrid intelligent system and the study of such systems is artificial intelligence systems integration
computers integration a hierarchical control system provides a bridge between sub symbolic ai at its lowest reactive levels and traditional symbolic ai
computers ai at its highest levels where relaxed time constraints permit planning and world modelling rodney brooks subsumption architecture was an early
computers early proposal for such a hierarchical system tools of ai research in the course of years of research ai has developed
computers developed a large number of tools to solve the most difficult problems in computer science a few of the most general
computers general of these methods are discussed below search and optimization main articles search algorithm optimization mathematics and evolutionary computation many problems
computers problems in ai can be solved in theory by intelligently searching through many possible solutions reasoning can be reduced to performing
computers performing a search for example logical proof can be viewed as searching for a path that leads from premises to conclusions
computers conclusions where each step is the application of an inference rule planning algorithms search through trees of goals and subgoals attempting
computers attempting to find a path to a target goal a process called means ends analysis robotics algorithms for moving limbs and
computers and grasping objects use local searches in configuration space many learning algorithms use search algorithms based on optimization simple exhaustive searches
computers searches are rarely sufficient for most real world problems the search space the number of places to search quickly grows to
computers to astronomical numbers the result is a search that is too slow or never completes the solution for many problems is
computers is to use heuristics or rules of thumb that eliminate choices that are unlikely to lead to the goal called pruning
computers pruning the search tree heuristics supply the program with a best guess for what path the solution lies on a very
computers very different kind of search came to prominence in the s based on the mathematical theory of optimization for many problems
computers problems it is possible to begin the search with some form of a guess and then refine the guess incrementally until
computers until no more refinements can be made these algorithms can be visualized as blind hill climbing we begin the search at
computers at a random point on the landscape and then by jumps or steps we keep moving our guess uphill until we
computers we reach the top other optimization algorithms are simulated annealing beam search and random optimization evolutionary computation uses a form of
computers of optimization search for example they may begin with a population of organisms the guesses and then allow them to mutate
computers mutate and recombine selecting only the fittest to survive each generation refining the guesses forms of evolutionary computation include swarm intelligence
computers intelligence algorithms such as ant colony or particle swarm optimization and evolutionary algorithms such as genetic algorithms and genetic logic main
computers main articles logic and automated reasoning logic was introduced into ai research by john mccarthy in his advice taker proposal in
computers in j alan robinson discovered a simple complete and entirely algorithmic method for logical deduction which can easily be performed by
computers by digital computers however a naive implementation of the algorithm quickly leads to a combinatorial explosion or an infinite loop in
computers in robert kowalski suggested representing logical expressions as horn clauses statements in the form of rules if p then q which
computers which reduced logical deduction to backward chaining or forward chaining this greatly alleviated but did not eliminate the problem logic is
computers is used for knowledge representation and problem solving but it can be applied to other problems as well for example the
computers the satplan algorithm uses logic for planning and inductive logic is a method for learning there are several different forms of
computers of logic used in ai research propositional or sentential logic is the logic of statements which can be true or false
computers false first order logic also allows the use of quantifiers and predicates and can express facts about objects their properties and
computers and their relations with each other fuzzy logic a version of first order logic which allows the truth of a statement
computers statement to be represented as a value between and rather than simply true or false fuzzy systems can be used for
computers for uncertain reasoning and have been widely used in modern industrial and consumer product control systems default logics non monotonic logics
computers logics and circumscription are forms of logic designed to help with default reasoning and the qualification problem several extensions of logic
computers logic have been designed to handle specific domains of knowledge such as description logics situation calculus event calculus and fluent calculus
computers calculus for representing events and time causal calculus belief calculus and modal logics probabilistic methods for uncertain reasoning main articles bayesian
computers bayesian network hidden markov model kalman filter decision theory and utility theory many problems in ai in reasoning planning learning perception

computers philosophy and psychology to computer science and neuroscience have been fraught with disagreement about the right approach in the computer scientist
computers scientist john mccarthy coined the term artificial intelligence ai to describe the study of intelligence by implementing its essential features on
computers on a computer instantiating an intelligent system using man made hardware rather than our own biological hardware of cells and tissues
computers tissues would show ultimate understanding and have obvious practical applications in the creation of intelligent devices or even robots some of
computers of mccarthy s colleagues in neighboring departments however were more interested in how intelligence is implemented in humans and other animals
computers animals first noam chomsky and others worked on what became cognitive science a field aimed at uncovering the mental representations and
computers and rules that underlie our perceptual and cognitive abilities chomsky and his colleagues had to overthrow the then dominant paradigm of
computers of behaviorism championed by harvard psychologist b f skinner where animal behavior was reduced to a simple set of associations between
computers between an action and its subsequent reward or punishment the undoing of skinner s grip on psychology is commonly marked by
computers by chomsky s critical review of skinner s book verbal behavior a book in which skinner attempted to explain linguistic ability
computers ability using behaviorist principles skinner s approach stressed the historical associations between a stimulus and the animal s response an approach
computers approach easily framed as a kind of empirical statistical analysis predicting the future as a function of the past chomsky s
computers s conception of language on the other hand stressed the complexity of internal representations encoded in the genome and their maturation
computers maturation in light of the right data into a sophisticated computational system one that cannot be usefully broken down into a
computers a set of associations behaviorist principles of associations could not explain the richness of linguistic knowledge our endlessly creative use of
computers of it or how quickly children acquire it with only minimal and imperfect exposure to language presented by their environment the
computers the language faculty as chomsky referred to it was part of the organism s genetic endowment much like the visual system
computers system the immune system and the circulatory system and we ought to approach it just as we approach these other more
computers more down to earth biological systems david marr a neuroscientist colleague of chomsky s at mit defined a general framework for
computers for studying complex biological systems like the brain in his influential book vision one that chomsky s analysis of the language
computers language capacity more or less fits into according to marr a complex biological system can be understood at three distinct levels
computers levels the first level computational level describes the input and output to the system which define the task the system is
computers is performing in the case of the visual system the input might be the image projected on our retina and the
computers the output might our brain s identification of the objects present in the image we had observed the second level algorithmic
computers algorithmic level describes the procedure by which an input is converted to an output i e how the image on our
computers our retina can be processed to achieve the task described by the computational level finally the third level implementation level describes
computers describes how our own biological hardware of cells implements the procedure described by the algorithmic level the approach taken by chomsky
computers chomsky and marr toward understanding how our minds achieve what they do is as different as can be from behaviorism the
computers the emphasis here is on the internal structure of the system that enables it to perform a task rather than on
computers on external association between past behavior of the system and the environment the goal is to dig into the black box
computers box that drives the system and describe its inner workings much like how a computer scientist would explain how a cleverly
computers cleverly designed piece of software works and how it can be executed on a desktop computer as today the history of
computers of cognitive science is a story of the unequivocal triumph of an essentially chomskyian approach over skinner s behaviorist paradigm an
computers an achievement commonly referred to as the cognitive revolution though chomsky himself rejects this term while this may be a relatively
computers relatively accurate depiction in cognitive science and psychology behaviorist thinking is far from dead in related disciplines behaviorist experimental paradigms and
computers and associationist explanations for animal behavior are used routinely by neuroscientists who aim to study the neurobiology of behavior in laboratory
computers laboratory animals such as rodents where the systematic three level framework advocated by marr is not applied in may of last
computers last year during the th anniversary of the massachusetts institute of technology a symposium on brains minds and machines took place
computers place where leading computer scientists psychologists and neuroscientists gathered to discuss the past and future of artificial intelligence and its connection
computers connection to the neurosciences the gathering was meant to inspire multidisciplinary enthusiasm for the revival of the scientific question from which
computers which the field of artificial intelligence originated how does intelligence work how does our brain give rise to our cognitive abilities
computers abilities and could this ever be implemented in a machine noam chomsky speaking in the symposium wasn t so enthused chomsky
computers chomsky critiqued the field of ai for adopting an approach reminiscent of behaviorism except in more modern computationally sophisticated form chomsky
computers chomsky argued that the field s heavy use of statistical techniques to pick regularities in masses of data is unlikely to
computers to yield the explanatory insight that science ought to offer for chomsky the new ai focused on using statistical learning techniques

computers the attempt to discover and implement the computational means to make machines behave in ways that would be called intelligent if
computers if a human were so behaving john mccarthy or to make them do things that would require intelligence if done by

computers is thought computationalism says that all thought is computation though many strong ai advocates are computationalists these are logically independent claims
computers claims some artificial computation being thought is consistent with some thought not being computation contra computationalism all thought being computation is

computers of either sex the interrogator stays in a room apart from the other two the object of the game for the
computers the interrogator is to determine which of the other two is the man and which is the woman the interrogator is
computers is allowed to put questions to a and b by teletype to avoid visual and auditory clues it is a s

computers hmms from data vc dimension this tutorial concerns a well known piece of machine learning theory if you ve got a

computers of the overfitting phenomenon you also end up with a method for estimating how well an algorithm will perform on future
computers future data that is solely based on its training set error and a property vc dimension of the learning algorithm vc
computers vc dimension thus gives an alternative to cross validation called structural risk minimization srm for choosing classifiers we ll discuss that

computers computer science has tried to muscle in on the kind of analytical problem that you would normally find in a statistics
computers statistics department markov decision processes how do you plan efficiently if the results of your actions are uncertain there is some
computers some remarkably good news and some some significant computational hardship we begin by discussing markov systems which have no actions and
computers and the notion of markov systems with rewards we then motivate and explain the idea of infinite horizon discounted future rewards
computers rewards and then we look at two competing approaches to deal with the ing computational problem given a markov system with
computers with rewards compute the expected long term discounted rewards the two methods which usually sit at opposite corners of the ring
computers ring and snarl at each other are straight linear algebra and dynamic we then make the leap up to markov decision
computers decision processes and find that we ve already done of the work needed to compute not only the long term rewards
computers rewards of each mdp state but also the optimal action to take in each state in addition to these slides for

computers networks is a sound and powerful methodology grounded on probability and statistics which allows building tractable joint probabilistic models that represents
computers represents the relevant dependencies among a set of variables hundreds of variables in real life applications the resulting models allow for
computers for efficient probabilistic inference for example a bayesian network could represent the probabilistic relationships between large scale synoptic fields and local
computers local observation records providing a new methodology for probabilstic downscaling i e allowing to compute p observation large scale prediction for
computers for instance the red dots in the figure below correspond to the grid nodes of a gcm whereas the blue dots
computers dots correspond to a network of stations with historical records the links show the relevant dependencies automatically discovered from data formally
computers formally bayesian networks are directed acyclic graphs whose nodes represent variables and whose arcs encode conditional independencies between the variables the
computers the graph provides an intuitive description of the dependency model and defines a simple factorization of the joint probability distribution leading
computers leading to a tractable model which is compatible with the encoded dependencies efficient algorithms exist to learn both the graphical and
computers and the probabilistic models from data thus allowing for the automatic application of this methodogy in complex problems bayesian networks that
computers that model sequences of variables such as for example time series of historical records are called dynamic bayesian networks generalizations of
computers of bayesian networks that can represent and solve decision problems under uncertainty are called influence diagrams on the other hand neural
computers neural networks are nonlinear models inspired in the functioning of the brain which have been designed to solve different problems thus
computers thus multi layer perceptrons are regression like algorithms to build a deterministic model y f x relating a set of predictors
computers predictors x and predictands y figure below left self organizing maps som are competitive networks designed for clustering and visualization purposes
computers purposes data mining the analysis step of the knowledge in databases process or kdd an interdisciplinary subfield of computer science is
computers is the computational process of discovering patterns in large data sets involving methods at the intersection of artificial intelligence machine learning
computers learning statistics and database systems the overall goal of the data mining process is to extract information from a data set
computers set and transform it into an understandable structure for further use aside from the raw analysis step it involves database and
computers and data management aspects data pre processing model and inference considerations interestingness metrics complexity considerations post processing of discovered structures visualization
computers visualization and online updating the term is a buzzword and is frequently misused to mean any form of large scale data
computers data or information processing collection extraction warehousing analysis and statistics but is also generalized to any kind of computer decision support
computers support system including artificial intelligence machine learning and business intelligence in the proper use of the word the key term is
computers is citation needed commonly defined as detecting something new even the popular book data mining practical machine learning tools and techniques
computers techniques with java which covers mostly machine learning material was originally to be named just practical machine learning and the term
computers term data mining was only added for marketing reasons often the more general terms large scale data analysis or analytics or
computers or when referring to actual methods artificial intelligence and machine learning are more appropriate the actual data mining task is the
computers the automatic or semi automatic analysis of large quantities of data to extract previously unknown interesting patterns such as groups of
computers of data records cluster analysis unusual records anomaly detection and dependencies association rule mining this usually involves using database techniques such
computers such as spatial indices these patterns can then be seen as a kind of summary of the input data and may
computers may be used in further analysis or for example in machine learning and predictive analytics for example the data mining step
computers step might identify multiple groups in the data which can then be used to obtain more accurate prediction results by a
computers a decision support system neither the data collection data preparation nor result interpretation and reporting are part of the data mining
computers mining step but do belong to the overall kdd process as additional steps the related terms data dredging data fishing and
computers and data snooping refer to the use of data mining methods to sample parts of a larger population data set that
computers that are or may be too small for reliable statistical inferences to be made about the validity of any patterns discovered
computers discovered these methods can however be used in creating new hypotheses to test against the larger data populations in the s
computers s statisticians used terms like data fishing or data dredging to refer to what they considered the bad practice of analyzing
computers analyzing data without an a priori hypothesis the term data mining appeared around in the database community at the beginning of
computers of the century there was a phrase database mining trademarked by hnc a san diego based company now merged into fico
computers fico to pitch their data mining workstation researchers consequently turned to data mining other terms used include data archaeology information harvesting
computers harvesting information knowledge extraction etc gregory piatetsky shapiro coined the term knowledge in databases for the first workshop on the same

computers data mining can only uncover patterns actually present in the data the target data set must be large enough to contain

computers is a data mart or data warehouse pre processing is essential to analyze the multivariate data sets before data mining the
computers the target set is then cleaned data cleaning removes the observations containing noise and those with missing data data mining involves
computers involves six common classes of tasks anomaly detection outlier change deviation detection the identification of unusual data records that might be
computers be interesting or data errors that require further investigation association rule learning dependency modeling searches for relationships between variables for example
computers example a supermarket might gather data on customer purchasing habits using association rule learning the supermarket can determine which products are
computers are frequently bought together and use this information for marketing purposes this is sometimes referred to as market basket analysis clustering
computers clustering is the task of discovering groups and structures in the data that are in some way or another similar without
computers without using known structures in the data classification is the task of generalizing known structure to apply to new data for
computers for example an e mail program might attempt to classify an e mail as legitimate or as spam regression attempts to
computers to find a function which models the data with the least error summarization providing a more compact representation of the data
computers data set including visualization and report generation results validation data mining can unintentionally be misused and can then produce results which
computers which appear to be significant but which do not actually predict future behavior and cannot be reproduced on a new sample
computers sample of data and bear little use often this results from investigating too many hypotheses and not performing proper statistical hypothesis
computers hypothesis testing a simple version of this problem in machine learning is known as overfitting but the same problem can arise
computers arise at different phases of the process and thus a train test split the final step of knowledge from data is
computers is to verify that the patterns produced by the data mining algorithms occur in the wider data set not all patterns
computers patterns found by the data mining algorithms are necessarily valid it is common for the data mining algorithms to find patterns
computers patterns in the training set which are not present in the general data set this is called overfitting to overcome this
computers this the evaluation uses a test set of data on which the data mining algorithm was not trained the learned patterns
computers patterns are applied to this test set and the resulting output is compared to the desired output for example a data
computers data mining algorithm trying to distinguish spam from legitimate emails would be trained on a training set of sample e mails
computers mails once trained the learned patterns would be applied to the test set of e mails on which it had not
computers not been trained the accuracy of the patterns can then be measured from how many e mails they correctly classify a
computers a number of statistical methods may be used to evaluate the algorithm such as roc curves if the learned patterns do
computers do not meet the desired standards subsequently it is necessary to re evaluate and change the pre processing and data mining
computers mining steps if the learned patterns do meet the desired standards then the final step is to interpret the learned patterns

computers mathematics georgia institute of technology cain math gatech edu february online education body margin machine learning is a scientific discipline that
computers that is concerned with the design and development of algorithms that allow computers to learn based on data such as from
computers from sensor data or databases a major focus of machine learning research is to automatically learn to recognize complex patterns and
computers and make intelligent decisions based on data hence machine learning is closely related to fields such as statistics probability theory data
computers data mining pattern recognition artificial intelligence adaptive control and theoretical computer science applications for machine learning include machine perception computer vision
computers vision natural language processing syntactic pattern recognition search engines medical diagnosis bioinformatics brain machine interfaces and cheminformatics detecting credit card fraud
computers fraud stock market analysis classifying dna sequences speech and handwriting recognition object recognition in computer vision game playing software engineering and
computers and robot locomotion machine learning algorithms are organized into a taxonomy based on the desired outcome of the algorithm common algorithm
computers algorithm types include supervised learning generates a function that maps inputs to desired outputs for example in a classification problem the
computers the learner approximates a function mapping a vector into classes by looking at input output examples of the function unsupervised learning
computers learning models a set of inputs labeled examples are not available semi supervised learning combines both examples to generate an appropriate
computers appropriate function or classifier reinforcement learning learns how to act given an observation of the world every action has some impact
computers impact in the environment and the environment provides feedback in the form of rewards that guides the learning algorithm transduction tries
computers tries to predict new outputs based on training inputs training outputs and test inputs learning to learn learns its own inductive
computers inductive bias based on previous experience the computational analysis of machine learning algorithms and their performance is a branch of theoretical
computers theoretical computer science known as computational learning theory because training sets are finite and the future is uncertain learning theory usually
computers usually does not yield absolute guarantees of the performance of algorithms instead probabilistic bounds on the performance are quite common in
computers in addition to performance bounds computational learning theorists study the time complexity and feasibility of learning in computational learning theory a
computers a computation is considered feasible if it can be done in polynomial time there are two kinds of time complexity results
computers results positive results show that a certain class of functions can be learned in polynomial time negative results show that certain
computers certain classes cannot be learned in polynomial time there are a lot of similarities between machine learning theory and statistics although
computers although they use different terms machine learning refers to a system capable of the autonomous acquisition and integration of knowledge this
computers this capacity to learn from experience analytical observation and other means results in a system that can continuously self improve and
computers and thereby offer increased efficiency and effectiveness machine learning is the subfield of ai that studies the automated acquisition of domain
computers domain specific knowledge the goal of these systems is to improve their performance as the result of experience studies in this
computers this field include problem classification and decomposition principals of intelligence reasoning and natural language processing machine learning can be looked at
computers at as a framework for doing ai research and development five main areas of machine learning are analytic learning methods neural
computers neural network connectionist learning methods genetic algorithms and classifier systems empirical methods for inducing rules and decision trees and case based
