health changed my runners every miles come to think of it why do i see so many runners with lower extremity injuries
health injuries in my office the traditional answer to these questions has always been overuse often compounded by an underlying mechanical abnormality
health abnormality such as over pronation or flat feet the treatment along with modification of training physiotherapy stretching etc has always included
health included a close look at the runner s footwear often with recommendations about motion control stability cushioning orthotics or custom molded
health molded insoles a growing body of literature in the field of sports medicine however is causing a bit of a stir
health stir no call it panic in the running world everything you and i always believed about running shoes and running injuries
health injuries may be wrong here s the scoop the modern running shoe itself may be the major cause of running injuries
health injuries stated another way the modern running shoe presently thought of a protective device should be reclassified as a health hazard
health hazard nike please tell me it ain t so now relax get back on your chair and take a deep breath
health breath we ll take this one step at a time and since we re going to be talking about shoes and
health and feet i may as well start at the beginning the very beginning until quite recently in our history most humans
health humans lived out their lives unshod s f stewart in his footgear it s history uses and abuses states that all
health all writers who have reported their observations of barefoot peoples agree that the untrammeled feet of natural men are free from
health from the disabilities commonly noted among shod people hallux valgus bunions hammer toe and painful feet so why was footgear developed
health developed one of the earliest examples of footgear known to us the form of sagebrush bark sandals found in caves and
health and rock shelters near fort rock oregon under a layer of volcanic ash dating back years the foot surface is smooth
health smooth and they were held on by bast straps over the instep similar sandals were used throughout the volcanic cordilleras of
health of meso and south america and the volcanic islands of the south pacific the early polynesians used sandals to cross old
health old lava flows and when fishing on the razor sharp coral it seems therefore that the prime function of the earliest
health earliest sandals was protection of the sole although the early pharaohs are all represented as barefoot by the first millennium bc
health bc sandals in egypt were common in court and were worn by soldiers in mesopotamian kingdoms sandals were evidently a status
health status symbol with the king known to have worn a wedged sandal in contrast to his flat soled courtiers very thick
health thick soled low boots are known to have been worn by greek tragedians to increase their height comedians wore socks or
health or soccus hence the expression high tragedy and low comedy thus the secondary function of footgear appears to have been symbolic
health symbolic from the time of the greeks footgear gradually evolved to meet both symbolic and functional needs for example tradition tells
health tells us that about the beginning of the present millennium count fulk of anjou introduced long pointed toes to cover up
health up some deformity of his feet and courtiers quickly adopted the fashion the mongols who on horseback ravaged the middle east
health east between damascus and moscow from the th th centuries are credited for the introduction of the block heel presumably developed
health developed to better grip the stirrup plate but in the french court of louis xiv the rugged mongolian heel underwent a
health a radical cosmetic transformation eventually leading to the ultimate idiotic expression of modern fashion the stiletto heel european peasants wore clogs
health clogs carved from a block of wood mass production seems to have begun prior to the th century for edward ii
health ii in decreed that shoes should be sized their length was measured in barleycorns to an inch this is still the
health the basis of shoe measurements inch to a size in length we start sizing from a baseline of in children and
health and in adults widths vary with length in a given size the widths vary by inch unpaired shoes were introduced in
health in england in the th century when gout became common and these shoes had broad square toes to relieve pressure the
health the most recent innovation seems to have been the hard box toe to preserve the appearance of the shoe now let
health let s focus in on the running shoe it seems that the earliest sports shoes were developed in the s by
health by the liverpool rubber company owned by john boyd dunlop although they were first called sand shoes because they were worn
health worn on the beach by the victorian middle classes they eventually became known as plimsolls because the lines formed by the
health the rubber and canvas bond looked similar to the plimsoll line on a ship s hull in dunlop launched its green
health green flash range of trainers adi dassler and his brother rudolf started making sports shoes in herzogenaurach germany in and in
health in jesse owens wore a pair of them when he won four olympic gold medals in berlin adidas adi dassler was
health was formed in with the now famous three stripes logo developing from three support leather bands used to bolster the sides
health sides by the olympics dozens of competitors were wearing adidas shoes rudolf dassler broke away to form puma amidst the first
health first rumblings of the jogging boom nike after the greek goddess of victory was launched by american phil knight a former
health former track star at the university of oregon and his waffle making coach bill bowerman in surely you remember the nike
health nike waffle trainer the nike swoosh is arguably the most successful logo in the world and was conceived for phil knight
health knight by a local oregon graphic design student carolyn davidson for a total fee of but don t worry about the
health the graphic designer in september nike presented carolyn davidson with a rather substantial share package as a way of saying thank
health thank you asics acronym for animus sanus in corpore sano latin for a sound mind in a sound body first introduced
health introduced its shoes in north america in while reebock named after a species of an african gazelle entered the us market
health market in as the running shoe was slowly transforming into a fashion item was declared the year of the running shoe
health shoe by the clothing industry the same year nike launched the cross trainer and it s flagship running shoe the air
health air max after years of research nike introduced its shox line of runners in arguably the first athletic shoe on springs
health springs foam part shoes and injuries for the last fifteen years or so buying a pair of runners has always been
health been accompanied by a warm fuzzy feeling inside a feeling that comes from the certain knowledge that you re investing in
health in a high tech device purpose designed to protect you from injury and improve your performance you can just see all
health all those smart dedicated nike mechanical engineers hard at work developing and testing newer and better space age materials to shield
health shield you from the terrible pounding you submit yourself to in order to just do it gel air channels honeycomb microspheres
health microspheres super light materials foam springs and soon yes you guessed it micro chips in the soles of your shoes better
health better than diamonds i suppose new round laces and ribbon eyelets result in that custom fitted feel supplemented by molded sorbothane
health sorbothane insoles or special orthotics from your local prosthetist and you re ready to tackle any distance now here s the
health the catch if all this high tech stuff is supposed to be preventing running injuries by shielding us from impact why
health why is it that two out of every three runners are sidelined every year because of a running injury why is
health is it that since the great jogging boom of the mid seventies there has been no decrease in the incidence some
health some authors say there has been an increase of running injures in spite of yearly improvements in running shoe technology why
health why is my office filled with runners who have injured knees of running injuries tibias achilles tendons and plantar fascias the
health the cause of all these injuries is quite evident cumulative micro trauma caused by repetitive impact experienced during running the heel
health heel of a runner upon striking the ground generates a force that can equal times body weight at the foot and
health and as much as times body weight at the hip repeat this times per mile and it s easy to appreciate
health appreciate the stress the old bones are under add to this the hardness of urban roadways compared to naturally deposited surfaces
health surfaces and eventually something gives inflammation sets in and pain results and you end up working at the finish line pulling
health pulling bar codes off finishers now where s our high tech shoe in all this with all the improvements in recent
health recent years you d think we d be seeing a marked decrease in running injuries just keep reading it wasn t
health t till the mid eighties that some researchers smelled something rotten in the athletic footwear world and it wasn t just
health just dirty socks footwear manufacturers were well aware that impact was the cause of running injuries and reasoned that the way
health way to attenuate impact was to interpose a soft impact absorbing midsole between the foot and the ground the first major
health major problem was the method used by essentially all the footwear development labs to test the impact absorption of footwear mid
health mid soles dr benno nigg from the university of calgary showed that machine testing of these materials by dropping a kg
health kg object onto the shoe sole and measuring the impact on a pressure plate did not accurately predict human impact with
health with the same materials in fact the correlation turned out to be inverse that is when you drop a kg ball
health ball on materials of increasing softness you measure decreasing impact however when the impact from a running human is measured the
health the result is the reverse and the impact increases with softer materials whoops you ll find out why later next problem
health problem in dr b marti published a paper which still makes the throats of footwear executives go dry he studied runners
health runners who participated in a km race and had them fill out an extensive questionnaire about their running in the year
health year preceding the race here s what he found the incidence of injuries in runners using shoes costing more than was
health was more that twice as great as in runners using shoes costing less than note that this result includes correction for
health for other influencing factors such as training mileage and history of previous injury in other words the fancier high tech advanced
health advanced the shoe the more dangerous it is now a study of over runners is not something to thumb your nose
health nose at and you would think the shoe manufacturers would have taken some notice not on your life yearly athletic shoe
health shoe sales were in the billions of dollars and this was no time to fiddle with a successful product in any
health any case it is felt by many observers that by the mid eighties researchers in house or independent had effectively been
health been forced out of the loop of new product development and that research and development was now exclusively in the hands
health hands of the marketing people athletic shoes had become a fashion item and were designed as such as they are to
health to this day the big question why are super shock absorbing athletic shoes causing more running injuries dr steven robbins from
health from the centre for studies in aging at mcgill university in montreal is the man who came up with the answer
health answer dr robbins pointed out that the human lower extremity is not a delicate rigid passive structure requiring packaging to protect
health protect it from impact this becomes blatantly obvious when one observes the nearly complete absence of foot disorders in unshod populations
health populations people who go around barefoot just don t get plantar fasciitis or any of the other lower extremity injuries so
health so common in shod populations the lower extremity he points out is a rugged flexible active well designed teleologically structure wire
health wire this structure to a spinal cord and a brain and what you ve got is a system fully capable of
health of handling the impacts of running so how does this system work exactly and why do modern running shoes screw it
health it up allow me for a moment to compare the human locomotor apparatus to a modern luxury car the bones of
health of the foot leg thigh and pelvis act as the frame linked by joints and all held together by fairly inelastic
health inelastic ligaments and fascia the bones and joints are surrounded by contracting muscles which act as the suspension system this is
health is especially evident in the arch of the foot which is formed by both the passive rigid plantar fascia as well
health well as the active flexible intrinsic muscles the bones and muscles are covered by fat and skin within which reside receptors
health receptors or sensors that send information to both the peripheral computer the spinal cord and the central computer the brain the
health the skin on the sole of the foot glabrous skin is very well suited to its function possessing about of the
health the toughness of hairy skin the skin everywhere else on our bodies except our palms the receptors in the foot are
health are specially designed to sense both impact vertical force and shear horizontal force add to this information streaming in from pain
health pain receptors as well as joint position receptors throughout the lower extremity and you ve got a hummer got carried away
health away a little sorry during barefoot running the ball of the foot strikes the ground first and immediately starts sending signals
health signals to the spinal cord and brain about the magnitude of impact and shear getting most of its clues about this
health this from the skin contact with the surface irregularities of the ground take away this contact by adding a cushioned substance
health substance and you immediately fool the system into underestimating the impact add a raised heel and the shod runner is forced
health forced to land on it strap the cushioning on tightly with the aid of a sophisticated lacing system and you block
health block out shear as well throwing the shock absorption system even further into the dark the system responds by landing harder
health harder in an attempt to compress the cushion and feel the ground the weight is then transferred to the outside edge
health edge of the foot completely by passing the skin of the arch the heel then touches down and the weight is
health is transferred to the ball again with final push off through the toes while the weight is being transferred the arch
health arch carries out its function as the suspension system of the foot and flattens under the active control of the intrinsic
health intrinsic muscles the ankle knee and hip joints flex to absorb impact in response to information flowing in from the foot
health foot the cushioned midsole of the modern running shoe robs the system of important sensory information necessary for ankle knee and
health and hip response to impact the arch support or orthotic in modern running shoes not only prevents the arch suspension system
health system from absorbing energy by preventing flattening but eventually leads to intrinsic muscle atrophy and complete loss of active muscular control
health control of the arch leaving only the inelastic plantar fascia as a checkrein to flattening the barefoot runner s foot position
health position awareness sense which relies heavily on sensory input from the sole of the foot minimizes his risk of sustaining an
health an ankle sprain on uneven ground the shod runner is at marked increased risk of ankle sprains because his foot position
health position awareness sense is handicapped by the paucity of sensations coming from his soles the barefoot runner is constantly alert scanning
health scanning the ground before him for irregularities and dangers that might cause him injury the barefoot runner is a cautious runner
health runner and actively changes his landing strategy to prevent injury he treads lightly the shod runner is bombarded by convincing advertising
health advertising stating or implying that the shoe he is wearing will protect him well over any terrain and he becomes a
health a careless runner he is heavy footed finally certain diseases in humans can cause a gradual destruction of the sensory nerve
health nerve endings in the foot and elsewhere resulting in a significant increase in lower extremity injuries diabetes and tertiary syphilis are
health are two extremities so affected are termed neuropathic the shod runner because of his sensory deprivation and high risk of injury
health injury may be termed as having pseudo neuropathic feet a term coined by robbins the conclusion that shoes are the primary
health primary cause of running injuries is strongly supported by the scientific literature i ve already mentioned marti s work showing more
health more than twice the incidence of running injuries with expensive shoes compared with cheap ones rao and joseph examined indian children
health children between the ages of and and found that the incidence of flat feet was more than three times greater in
health in those children who used footwear than in those who did not leading them to conclude that shoe wearing in early
health early childhood is detrimental to the development of a normal arch in hamill and bates showed that as running shoes lose
health lose their cushioning through wear and tear subjects improve foot control on testing and presumably decrease their risk of injury i
health i e shoes get better with age robbins and gouw showed in that modern athletic footwear creates a perceptual illusion in
health in subjects whereby they consistently impact simply adding surface irregularities on the insoles to simulate barefoot like conditions markedly improves subjects
health subjects s of impact robbins and others studied the balance ability of men walking along a beam wearing shoes with soles
health soles of varying thickness and hardness results confirmed that the thinner and harder the soles the better the balance in one
health one of their most elegant and widely publicized studies robbins and waked examined the effect of advertising on landing impact they
health they asked subjects to step down barefoot ten times onto four pressure measuring platforms the first one being bare and the
health the other three covered by identical shoe sole material made to look different by different colored cloth the subjects were given
health given different messages for each of the covered plates the message for the first covered plate suggested superior impact absorption and
health and protection deceptive message the second suggested poor impact absorption and high injury risk warning message and the third suggested unknown
health unknown impact absorption and safety neutral message results showed that subjects landed with the highest impact when given the deceptive and
health and neutral messages and with the lowest impact when given the warning message or with the bare plate the authors conclude
health conclude that running injury rates are greatest in users of the most expensive shoes because advertising has deceived these users into
health into believing that the shoes provide a superior level of safety thereby inducing an attenuation of impact moderating behavior increasing impact
health impact and injury the authors add that deceptive advertising of protective devices is a public health hazard and should be addressed
health addressed humans are less cautious even when they use truthfully advertised products because of excessively positive attitudes toward new products and
health and wrong impressions of the standards of truth in advertising so you think is this guy telling me that nike reebock
health reebock and all those big corporations just put this new stuff out on the market without any proof that its safe
health safe can t be well that s exactly what i m telling you i can be a real pain in the
health the ass when i try and some years back i was in the mood i got on the phone and tried
health tried to talk to the directors of research at all the big athletic footwear companies i tell you getting to talk
health talk to one of these guys is harder than talking to the pope i finally got to speak with mr gordon
health gordon valiant then director of research at the nike sports research lab in beaverton oregon jf mr valiant my name is
health is dr froncioni and i m an orthopedic surgeon i treat a lot of runners and i was just wondering what
health what your thoughts were on the whole issue of running injuries possibly being caused by your running shoes long pause gv
health gv umm well i m afraid i m not at liberty to discuss that matter say what jf mr valiant in
health in case you missed it i m not a reporter i m just an orthopedic surgeon who s looking for some
health some answers for his patients let me rephrase surely you have data to support the injury protection claims you make about
health about your running shoes surely sir gv well i could refer you to our marketing people and i m sure they
health they could send you something nope we re not on the same wavelength at all i m sure the lawyers have
health have given these guys a gag order jf mr valiant your marketing people send me stuff all the time it s
health s all over the runner s world i get every anyway nice talking to you i ve also had a few
health few chats with dr steven robbins he feels very strongly that the athletic footwear manufacturers are painting themselves into a very
health very tight corner by not acting on the available information after all it is within their power to effect changes in
health in their shoe design based on the available data and in doing so decreasing the running injury rate by up to
health to by not acting now dr robbins predicts the footwear manufacturers may end up in the same situation as the tobacco
health tobacco companies with massive class action lawsuits brought against them part new directions so what do we do now for starters
health starters no i do not recommend that you run your next half marathon barefoot but certainly i predict that sooner or
health or later changes will come about in both shoe design and training from the medical establishment s point of view the
health the prevention and treatment of running injuries must change to incorporate the concepts outlined above in fact i view the ideas
health ideas i ve presented here as a major paradigm shift in sports medicine the likes of which i have not seen
health seen in the last fifteen years of course the major shoe companies have to own up and start introducing better shoes
health shoes into their lines why not do this gradually and introduce just one shoe that incorporates some of the recommended changes
health changes dr robbins is already testing shoes that use a thinner less resilient midsole material that provides the comfort but not
health not the impact absorption and of course has no arch support i m sure the marketing boys at nike could handle
health handle it without being too radical there are some changes that are worth introducing without further delay and they are as
health as s young children should be encouraged to spend as much time as possible barefoot we know that this is especially
health especially important for the proper formation of the foot arch in the first six years of life so moms trash the
health the weebocks and let your kids develop strong healthy feet just as they were meant to runners should consider incorporating sessions
health sessions of barefoot running into their training in an article in the october runner s world adam bean gives the ing
health ing advice running barefoot a couple of times per week can decrease your risk of injury and boost your push off
health off power you can run on any surface you like as long as you re careful of sharp objects and pebbles
health pebbles soft sand is probably the least desirable surface because it is unstable and after your heel has dug in you
health you will weight bear on your arch paved roads are fine and dangerous objects are easy to spot but remember your
health your feet will need to toughen up so start with small doses kick your shoes off as soon as you get
health get home and spend your evenings and weekends barefoot is it possible to rehabilitate the weakened muscles of a normally shod
health shod runner it certainly is according to another excellent study by dr robbins he asked normally shod recreational runners to gradually
health gradually increase barefoot activity both at home and outdoors over a period of several weeks and to maintain barefoot activity for
health for about four s the runners feet were examined measured and x rayed at regular intervals to detect changes results showed
health showed marked improvement in the anatomy and function of the arch the authors concluded that the normally shod foot is capable
health capable of rehabilitation of foot musculature very good news indeed for all of us runners may want to consider switching to
health to a lightweight shoe that provides less cushioning and no arch support the only shoes on the market that come close
health close to these characteristics are racing flats i use the oz asics gel magic racer for you diehard nike fans consider
health consider the air streak ii air streak spectrum plus or the air streak vapor iv but most shoe manufactures make a
health a flat a shoe that nike has just introduced this year the nike free also looks like a step in the
health the right direction i have not actually seen this shoe myself yet moreover a look at the nike free web page
health page give me a bit of hope that this company may finally have seen the light if you do change to
health to flats i recommend you wean into them slowly remember that you live in a developed country and that your feet
health feet have been shielded from natural stresses your entire life i e you ve got wimpy feet buddy the intrinsic muscles
health muscles of your feet are asleep and need to wake up slowly the first thing that will strike you in a
health a racing flat is the lightness of the shoe most runners today run in shoes that weigh as much as oz
health oz then you will quickly realize that for the first time you start to feel the ground you are walking on
health on oh and one more thing don t listen to the guy at the running store he s there to sell
health sell shoes and is under the spell of the powerful shoe industry advertising machine he has become well and truly brainwashed
health brainwashed with the traditional concepts that we all need cushioning and arch support he will try to dissuade you from buying
health buying a racing flat and he may even go as far as telling you that they are for elite runners and
health and are meant to be used for one marathon only don t believe him i keep my flats for at least
health least miles with no problem finally some radicals among you may wish to become full time barefoot runners barefoot running clubs
health clubs are springing up all over america and europe point your search engine to barefoot running shoes and stress fracture s

health force tobacco companies to pay some smoking related health care costs in washington d c the environmental protection agency has claimed
health claimed that secondhand smoke is a significant risk for nonsmokers and the food drug administration is making noises about regulating nicotine
health nicotine as a drug and recently the american medical association agreed reasserting that nicotine is addictive smokers have already been driven
health driven away from many workplaces into the street for a furtive puff but further legal harassment to the point of what
health what an industry spokesman calls backdoor prohibition seems unstoppable lost in this lynching frenzy the fact that smoking might be in
health in some small ways good for you hold on now let s be clear the surgeon general has indeed determined that
health that smoking is dangerous to your health lung cancer and cardiovascular diseases are highly correlated with cigarette consumption annual smoking related
health related deaths are commonly said to be over although critics say the number is inflated but so is driving automobiles dangerous
health dangerous to your health over deaths a year yet people do it because it has rewards as well as risk and
health and they judge as individuals that the reward outweighs the risk this is called freedom well what are the rewards of
health of cigarette smoking apart from intangible pleasure the most obvious is behavioral a battery of studies such as those by british
health british researcher d m warburton show that cigarettes whatever their other effects really do stimulate alertness dexterity and cognitive capacity and
health and alertness dexterity etc can be useful such as when driving or flying as congress recognized when it exempted airline pilots
health pilots from the ban on smoking on domestic flights these behavioral benefits suggest an answer to the great tobacco mystery why
health why almost a third of adult americans continue to do something they are told incessantly and insistently is bad for them
health them duke university economist w kip viscusi reported in his book smoking making the risky decision that survey data show smokers
health smokers if anything exaggerate the health danger of their habit smokers according to numerous studies such as those by university of
health of michigan researchers ovide and cynthia pomerleau are different from nonsmokers they tend toward depression and excitability current understanding is that
health that nicotine is amphoteric that is it can act to counter both conditions depending on how it is consumed quick puffs
health puffs stimulate long drags calm the implication is fascinating a large part of the population seems to be aware of its
health its significant although not pathological personality quirks and to have discovered a form of self medication that regulates them of course
health course this explanation for the stubbornness of smokers is not as satisfying as what washington prefers to believe mass seduction by
health by the wicked tobacco companies and their irresistible advertising nor would it justify huge rescue operations by heroic politicians and bureaucrats
health bureaucrats beyond its behavioral effects smoking seems also to offer subtler health rewards to balance against its undisputed risks parkinson s
health s disease the frequency of this degenerative disorder of the nervous system among smokers appears to be half the rate among
health among nonsmokers an effect recognized by the surgeon general as along ago as alzheimer s disease similarly the frequency of this
health this degenerative mental disorder has recently been found to be as much as less among smokers than among nonsmokers for example
health example by the h studies reviewed in the international journal of epidemiology in endometrial cancer there is extensive and long standing
health standing evidence that this disease of the womb occurs as much as less among smokers as documented by for example a
health a new england journal of medicine article back in the triggering mechanism appears to be a reduction of estrogen levels prostate
health prostate cancer conversely smoking seems to raise estrogen levels in men and may be responsible for what appears to be a
health a lower rate of prostate cancer among smokers although this needs corroboration osteoarthritis this degenerative disorder of bone and cartilage is
health is up to five times less likely to occur among heavy smokers as documented for example by the federal government s
health s first health and nutrition examination survey colon cancer ulcerative colitis these diseases of the bowel seem to be about and
health and less frequent among smokers as documented for example by articles in the journal of the american medical association and in
health in the new england journal of medicine in and respectively other benefits that have been suggested for smoking lower rates of
health of sarcoidosis and allergic alveolitis both lung disorders and possibly even acne smokers are also lighter ironically because obesity is a
health a leading cause of the cardiovascular disease that smoking is also supposed to exacerbate so you could quit smoking and still
health still die of a heart attack because of the weight you put on none of these health benefits is enough to
health to persuade doctors to recommend occasional cigarettes in the way that some now occasionally recommend a glass of wine but consider
health consider this theoretical possibility should year olds take up smoking because its protection against alzheimer s is more immediate that its
health its potential damage to the lungs which won t show up for years if at all a theoretical possibility and likely
health likely to remain theoretical research into possible benefits of tobacco and nicotine is widely reported to be stymied by the absolutist
health absolutist moral fervor of the antismoking campaign under the carter administration the federal government abandoned its research into safer cigarettes in
health in favor of an attack on all smoking no effort is made to encourage smokers to switch to pipes and cigars
health cigars although their users lung cancer and heart disease rates are five to ten times lower somewhat offset by minor increases
health increases in mouth and throat cancers there is no current support for studies of the marginal increase in danger for each
health each cigarette smoked although it appears the human system can clear the effects of three to five of the much stronger
health stronger pre cigarettes if dispersed across a day with relatively little risk instead the extirpation of smoking had become another moral
health moral equivalent of war as president carter called the energy crisis in the s and as price and wage controls were
health were viewed earlier there is no role for tradeoffs risk reward calculations or free choice why don t tobacco companies point
health point out the potential offsetting rewards of smoking besides the usual corporate cowardice and bureaucratic inertia the answer may be another
health another typically american disease lawyers directing the companies defense they apparently veto any suggestion that smoking has benefits for fear of
health of liability suits and of the possible regulatory implications if nicotine is seen as a drug which leaves smokers defenseless against
health against a second typically american disease infomania worse than marijuana many workers are always on standby to react to incoming messages
health messages workers distracted by email and phone calls suffer a fall in iq more than twice that found in marijuana smokers
health smokers new research has claimed the study for computing firm hewlett packard warned of a rise in infomania with people becoming

health clark posted wednesday october too many people have been turned off of running simply by trying to start off too fast

health you should ease into your running program gradually in fact the beginners program we outline here is less of a running

health you running three miles or k on a regular basis in just two s it s easy to get impatient and
health and you may feel tempted to skip ahead in the program but hold yourself back don t try to do more
health more even if you feel you can if on the other hand you find the program too strenuous just stretch it
health it out don t feel pressured to continue faster than you re able repeat weeks if needed and move ahead only
health only when you feel you re ready a few minutes each week each session should take about or minutes three times
health times a week that just happens to be the same amount of moderate exercise recommended by numerous studies for optimum fitness
health fitness this program will get you fit runners who do more than this amount are doing it for more than fitness
health fitness and before long you might find yourself doing the same as well be sure to space out these three days
health days throughout the week to give yourself a chance to rest and recover between efforts and don t worry about how
health how fast you re going running faster can wait until your bones are stronger and your body is fitter for now
health now focus on gradually increasing the time or distance you run run for time or run for distance there are two
health two ways to this program to measure your runs by time or by distance either one works just as well choose
health choose the option that seems easiest for you to keep track of if you go with the distance option and you
health you are not using a track to measure the distances just it s not important to have the distances absolutely exact

health to modify common postural inefficiencies in many of my clients it is very common for people to develop a weak middle
health middle back and poor activation of the inner thigh and hip muscles as well as restriction of the hip joints and
health and of course poor activation of the abdominal muscles if you are not exercising at all start gently and perform one
health one set of each exercise daily for a few weeks after that you can most likely better assess what your capabilities
health capabilities are with the exercises listed as progressions do the one that matches your level of ability rest about seconds between
health between sets and up to one minute between exercises even if you are exercising regularly if you have recurring issues like
health like upper back tension headaches lower back or knee pain there is a good chance you have something out of balance

health above your head and connect the whole of your arm and hand to the wall slide the arms down keeping the
health the forearms vertical and the elbows as close to your trunk as possible without breaking contact with the wall and without
health without causing excessive increase in your low back arch perform sets of repetitions scapular pushups starting in the up position of
health of a standard pushup from the toes keep the elbows locked and body straight while pinching and releasing your shoulder blades
health blades be sure not to shrug your shoulders towards your ears perform sets of repetitions pull downs gripping a towel overhead
health overhead with your hands shoulder width apart maintain a constant pulling force as if trying to elongate the towel or trying
health trying to separate your hands apart while bringing the towel down behind your neck then back up again make sure to
health to try and bring your elbows as close to your body as you can and to stay tall and upright throughout
health throughout the movement perform sets of up to repetitions flying cobras lying face down arms extended over your head with your
health your thumbs pointed to the sky raise your upper chest off the floor concentrating the movement from the mid back not
health not the lumbar region once off the floor bring both arms down to your sides as close to your body as
health as you can while keeping the thumbs pointed to the sky at all times then returning them to the starting position
health position and lowering yourself back to the floor perform sets of up to repetitions pushup stability progressions perform sets of repetitions

health a t shape return to the starting position and perform the same movement on the other side repeat for reps t
health t pushups as in the t twists but perform a push up each time you return to the start position squat
health squat stretch drop into a deep squat with your arms on the inside of your knees hook your fingers over your
health your toes without letting go of your toes straighten your legs and let your buttocks rise to the sky hold the
health the position for a moment before dropping back down into the deep squat perform sets of repetitions loaded squat perform standard
health standard squats while holding a weight plate with both hands keeping your arms extended forward it is not necessary for the
health the weight to be heavy only enough to trigger the abdominals to stabilize perform sets of repetitions dead bug progression perform
health perform sets of repetitions of one of these variations depending on your ability basic lying on the floor face up knees
health knees bent tilt pelvis back and activate your lower abs and obliques to press your lower back flat into the floor

health of one without allowing your lower back to come up off the floor return to the starting position and repeat on
health on the other side perform for reps basic with arms as basic but start with the arms held above the head
health head with each leg movement swing the arms down so the point in the same direction as the leg then swing
health swing the arms back as the leg returns to the starting position intermediate start with the legs in the air hips
health hips and knees bent and degrees intermediate with arms arm movement with each leg movement shoulder bridge perform sets of repetitions
health repetitions of one of these variations depending on your ability basic lying on the floor face up knees bent lift your
health your pelvis off the ground and squeeze your buttock muscles as you press your hips towards the sky when you drop
health drop back down do not rest on the ground repeat for reps advanced hug one knee to your chest and perform
health perform the movement one leg at a time perform all reps with one side before moving to the other side always
health always start with whichever side is known to be weaker split squat begin in a forward lunge position with the rear
health rear foot elevated on a bench or chair lower yourself so your rear knee comes close to the floor either hold
health hold for a quad stretch or perform sets of repetitions remember to step deep and drive with your lead heel to
health to return to the up position stay tall and do not lean forward or round your back straddle split the legs
health legs as wide apart as possible from a standing position keeping the toes pointing forward hold for a static stretch or

health feet back together simultaneously stay upright sumo squat from a standing position with your feet wider than shoulders toes pointing degrees
health degrees outward drop down into squat staying tall then return to the starting position keep the knees moving over the toes
health toes do not let your knees fall inwards narrow your foot position slightly to help keep good knee alignment perform sets
health sets of repetitions leg whip perform the advanced shoulder bridge and hold in the up position but instead of hugging one

health of repetitions on each side shin curls while sitting with both legs extended and holding a dumbbell between your feet flex

health the foot perform sets of repetitions on both sides hospital how disciplined are you about your early morning routine if you

health the early bird gets the worm award goes to padmasree warrior chief technology officer for motorola who rises at a m

health ground with your toes as they come forward eye care how to exercise your eyes we all know how important it
health it is to keep our bodies fit by doing things like going to the gym jogging and swimming but did you
health you know that you can exercise your eyes as well while eye exercising won t improve your vision it will keep
health keep your eyes healthy and help minimize eyestrain steps sit comfortably on a chair rub your hands together until they feel
health feel warm close your eyes and cover them lightly with your cupped palms avoid applying pressure on your eyeballs place your
health your palms so that the nose remains uncovered and the eyes remain behind the slight hollow of the palms make sure
health sure that no light rays enter the eyes and leave no gaps between fingers or between the edge of the palms
health palms and the nose you may still see other lingering traces of colors imagine deep blackness and focus on the blackness
health blackness take deep breaths slowly and evenly while thinking of some happy incident or visualize a distant scene after your eyes
health eyes see nothing but blackness remove your palms from your eyes repeat the palming for minutes or more close your eyes
health eyes tightly for seconds then open them for seconds repeat this or times close your eyes and massage them with circular
health circular movements of your fingers for minutes make sure you press very lightly otherwise you could hurt your eyes press three
health three fingers of each hand against your upper eyelids and hold them there for seconds then release repeat times sit and
health and relax roll your eyes clockwise then counter clockwise repeat times and blink in between each time sit about inches from
health from the window make a mark on the glass at your eye level a small sticker black or red would be
health be perfect look through this mark and focus on something far away for seconds then focus on the mark again hold
health hold a pencil in front of you at arm s length move your arm slowly to your nose and the pencil
health pencil with your eyes until you can t keep it in focus repeat times look in front of you at the
health the opposite wall and pretend that you are writing with your eyes without turning your head it may seem difficult at
health at first but with a bit of practice it is really fun the bigger the letters the better the effect imagine
health imagine that you are standing in front of a really big clock look at the middle of the clock then look
health look at any hour mark without turning your head look back at the center then look at another hour mark do
health do this at least times you can also do this exercise with your eyes closed focus on a distant object over
health over feet away for several seconds and slowly refocus your eyes on a nearby object less than feet away that s
health s in the same direction focus for several seconds and go back to the distant object do this times focus on
health on an object in the distance as far as possible with a low contrasting background do this for a few minutes
health minutes every half hour or so this does not improve your vision nor does any other technique it can however maintain
health maintain your best eyesight level during the day and prevent significant further vision deterioration tips it is more important to do
health do the exercises regularly than to do them for a long time even seconds of eye movement every hour is very
health very helpful for example when your computer its sweet time to do something most people just swear at the poor thing
health thing and waste the time but you can make a few circles with your eyes even the first day you do
health do this you should notice that when you finish working your eyes aren t as tired as usual taking short breaks
health breaks from near work e g staring at a computer monitor to stare out to the distance also relieves some strain
health strain warnings consult your eye doctor before doing any of these exercises the last thing you want to do is add
health add further strain to your eyes or damage them permanently when doing these exercises make sure that you re not facing
health facing anybody or that they know you re doing eye exercises otherwise they might think you ve gone nuts extensive peer
health peer reviewed research has shown that visual clarity is not improved by exercise some people have weakness in the ability to
health to turn their eye in or out you may have esotropia eye naturally turned in or exotropia eye naturally turned out
health out exercise may help these conditions doing these exercises when you wear contacts may cause them suction to your eyeball they
health they might also move around and possibly become folded and or dislodged which can be extremely uncomfortable as well do not
health not apply pressure on your eyes things you ll need pencil related wikihows how to take care of your eyes how

health pages with ease active sitting on an exercise ball chair engages your postural muscles and allows you to experience the benefits
health benefits of movement while remaining seated sitting on a ball chair provides you with more energy and helps you stay alert
health alert throughout the day since you re constantly in some type of motion by creating an unstable surface to sit on
health on your body must find the most efficient way to balance since the best way to sit is with proper spinal
health spinal alignment you will have a natural tendency to sit upright with good posture while on an exercise ball chair sitting
health sitting on a ball chair will help improve your balance posture core stability and core strength the challenge of continuously restabilizing
health restabilizing your torso while sitting on an exercise ball chair strengthens spinal and abdominal muscles it also helps improve circulation allowing
health allowing you to sit without back stiffness and fatigue research has shown that seemingly minor physical activity such as active sitting
health sitting can burn up to extra calories a day so sit actively on a ball chair and stay lean which exercise
health exercise ball chair is best for me most of our customers choose the fitterfirst classic exercise ball chair for office use
health use the classic exercise ball is rated burst resistant to lb and can also be used for moderate exercise applications our
health our dura ball pro exercise ball is designed primarily for use as a professional exercise ball and is burst resistant to
health to lb it can also be used as a ball chair but is firmer than the classic ball and is best
health best used slightly underinflated for sitting an under inflated over sized exercise ball is the most comfortable for sitting for example

health the full novice training schedule hit the button for the full novice training schedule people differ greatly in ability but ideally
health ideally before starting a marathon program you should have been running about a year you should be able to comfortably run
health run distances between and miles you should be training days a week averaging miles a week you should have run an
health an occasional k or k race it is possible to run a marathon with less of a training base particularly if
health if you come from another sport but the higher your fitness level the easier this week program will be this program
health program consists of several different increments long runs the key to the program is the long run on weekends which builds
health builds from miles in week to miles in the climactic week after that you taper to get ready for the marathon
health marathon you can skip an occasional workout or juggle the schedule depending on other commitments but do not cheat on the
health the long runs notice that although the weekly long runs get progressively longer every third week is a stepback week where
health where we reduce mileage to allow you to gather strength for the next push upward rest is an important component of
health of any training program run slow normally i recommend that runners do their long runs anywhere from to seconds per mile
health mile slower than their marathon pace the problem with offering this advice to novice runners however is that you probably don
health don t know what your marathon pace is because you ve never run a marathon before don t worry simply do
health do your long runs at a comfortable pace one that allows you to converse with your training partners at least during
health during the beginning of the run toward the end you may need to abandon conversation and concentrate on the act of
health of putting one foot in front of the other to finish however if you find yourself finishing at a pace significantly
health significantly slower than your pace in the first few miles you probably need to start much slower or include regular walking
health walking breaks it s better to run too slow during these long runs than too fast the important point is that
health that you cover the prescribed distance how fast you cover it doesn t matter walking breaks that includes walking breaks walking
health walking is a perfectly acceptable strategy in trying to finish a marathon it works during training runs too while some coaches
health coaches recommend walking minute out of every or walking minute every mile in the cara marathon training class we teach runners
health runners to walk when they come to an aid station this serves a double function you can drink more easily while
health while walking as opposed to running and since many other runners slow or walk through aid stations you ll be less
health less likely to block those behind it s a good idea to this strategy in training as well our class that
health that trains on the lakefront finds water fountains also known as bubblers every mile or more often we teach them to
health to stop frequently to drink our classes that train elsewhere in the suburbs don t always have easy access to fluids
health fluids but we teach them to wear a water belt and also stop frequently to drink you will lose less time
health time walking than you think i once ran a marathon walking through every aid station my son kevin ran and qualified
health qualified for the olympic trials employing a similar strategy and bill rodgers took four brief breaks tying a shoe on one
health one of them while running and winning the boston marathon walking gives your body a chance to rest and you ll
health ll be able to continue running more comfortably it s best to walk when you want to not when your fatigued
health fatigued body forces you too cross training sundays in this training program are devoted to cross training what is cross training
health training it is any other form of aerobic exercise that allows you to use slightly different muscles while resting usually after
health after your long run in this program we run long on saturdays and cross train on sundays although it certainly is
health is possible to reverse that order the best cross training exercises are swimming cycling or even walking what about sports such
health such as tennis or basketball activities requiring sideways movements are not always a good choice particularly as the mileage builds up
health up toward the end of the program you raise your risk of injury if you choose to play a sport that
health that requires sudden stopping and starting one tip you don t have to cross train the same each weekend and you
health you could even combine two or more exercises walking and easy jogging or swimming and riding an exercise bike in a
health a health club cross training for an hour on sunday will help you recover after your saturday long runs midweek training
health training training during the week also should be done at a comparatively easy pace as the weekend mileage builds the weekday
health weekday mileage also builds add up the numbers and you ll see that you run roughly the same mileage during the
health the week as you do during long runs on the weekends midweek workouts on wednesdays build from to miles i call
health call these my sorta long runs there are similar slight advances on tuesdays and thursdays the program is built on the
health the concept that you do more toward the end than at the start that sounds logical doesn t it believe me
health me as tens of thousands of marathoners using this schedule have proved it works rest despite my listing it at the
health the end rest is an important component of this or any training program scientists will tell you that it is during
health during the rest period the to hours between hard bouts of exercise that the muscles actually regenerate and get stronger coaches
health coaches also will tell you that you can t run hard unless you are well rested and it is hard running
health running such as the long runs that allows you to improve if you re constantly fatigued you will fail to reach
health reach your potential this is why i include two days of rest each week for novice runners if you need to
health to take more rest days because of a cold or a late night at the office or a sick child do
health do so the secret to success in any training program is consistency so as long as you are consistent with your
health your training during the full weeks of the program you can afford and may benefit from extra rest interactive training if
health if you would like more help with your marathon training sign up for my inter active training and i will send
health send you emails daily telling you how to train the daily emails include even more tips than are available here on
health on my website plus you can log your training and use other features to learn more about your inter active training
health training options click here here are your novice training schedules the below chart tells you what to do for each day
health day for the weeks leading to the marathon click on the week numbers on the left side of the chart to
health to be taken to the weekly schedules with detailed instructions aerobic vs anaerobic exercise exercise falls into two general categories aerobic
health aerobic and anaerobic aerobic exercise is muscle movement that uses oxygen to burn both carbohydrates and fats to produce energy while
health while anaerobic exercise is muscle movement that does not require oxygen and only burns carbohydrates to produce energy in practice aerobic
health aerobic exercise means activities such as walking bicycling or swimming that temporarily increase your heart rate and respiration aerobic exercise also
health also known as cardiovascular exercise builds your endurance anaerobic exercise typically means activities such as weightlifting and push ups and sit
health sit ups which builds muscle and physical strength through short bursts of strenuous activity an ideal exercise program should include both
health both aerobic and anaerobic exercise basal metabolic rate bmr bmr is the number of calories per day your body burns at
health at rest to maintain normal body functions such as breathing breaking down food and keeping your heart and brain working your
health your age sex height weight and level of physical activity influence your bmr it tends to go down as you get
health get older but it may rise if you begin exercising regularly and building more muscle mass most people s bmr is
health is between and there is no target number but it can be helpful to know yours if you re starting an
health an exercise program with the goal of losing weight since you may want to know how many calories you re getting
health getting from food vs how many your body burns each day without exercise you can get an by using an on
health on line bmr calculator endurance training vs strength or resistance training these terms correlate with aerobic and anaerobic exercise aerobic exercise
health exercise builds endurance and anaerobic exercise builds strength since strength training often involves using muscles to work against the force of
health of weights it s also known as resistance training strength training boosts the amount of muscle in your body by making
health making your muscles work harder than they re used to another important difference is that endurance training should be done on
health on most days but strength training should be performed only two or three times a week in order to give your
health your muscles time to recover isotonic vs isometric exercise isotonic and isometric are both types of exercises people can do during
health during strength training isotonic exercise occurs when faced with resistance it can overcome a muscle contracts and temporarily shortens thereby moving
health moving the attached joint a set of bench presses or chin ups are examples of isotonic exercise by contrast isometric exercise
health exercise occurs when the muscle contracts against a fixed resistance so no muscle shortening or joint movement occurs examples include pushing
health pushing against a wall or trying to a lift a weight that s too heavy to budge isotonic exercise builds muscle
health muscle strength and endurance without overtaxing your cardiovascular system so it s usually the foundation of a strength training program isometric
health isometric exercise quickly builds muscle strength but it should be done with caution or avoided altogether because it s stressful on
health on your heart and circulatory system metabolic equivalents mets metabolic equivalents are units used to the oxygen consumption a particular physical
health physical activity requires and as a result its intensity one met is the d energy cost of sitting quietly as you
health you engage in more vigorous activity your oxygen demands go up and so do the mets assigned to that activity for
health for example activities such as walking slowly yoga and housework use about mets fast walking and doubles tennis use to and
health and jogging shoveling snow and singles tennis use more than the typical person uses about milliliters of oxygen per kilogram pounds
health pounds of body weight per minute that s referred to as a single met another way to think about it a
health a single met is your activity intensity when you are sitting around doing nothing an activity is rated at mets if
health if it requires twice as much oxygen as simply sitting milliliters of oxygen per kilogram of body weight per minute at
health at mets if it requires four times as much oxygen and so forth sometimes met minutes or met hours are used
health used to take into account how long someone exercises if you walk at a pace of three miles per hour for
health for minutes you accumulate a grand total of met minutes mets x minutes met minutes jog at a pace of five
health five miles per hour for minutes and met minutes redound to your physical activity credit mets x minutes met minutes physical
health physical activity physical activity is any movement produced by the contraction of skeletal muscle that increases energy expenditure above a basal
health basal level it can be categorized by mode walking biking rowing and so and by the intensity how much work is
health is being performed sometimes exercise experts use relative intensity which is a person s subjective assessment of how much effort they
health they were making during a physical activity the borg scale is commonly used to measure this perceived exertion target heart rate
health rate several measures of your heart rate can be useful when you begin an exercise program in addition to the number
health number of beats per minute when you re idle resting heart rate and the number during peak physical activity such as
health as a stress test maximum heart rate there s your target heart rate a goal that gives your heart and lungs
health lungs the most benefit from a workout experts typically advise people to aim for a target heart rate of of their
health their maximum rate when they re starting out and as high as as fitness improves most people s resting heart rate
health rate is to beats per minute and maximum heart rate is typically about minus your age e g for a year
health year old you can check whether you re hitting your target heart rate during exercise by feeling your pulse frequently or
health or wearing a heart rate monitor many health centers have aerobic exercise machines with built in heart rate monitors vo max
health max vo max is the maximum amount of oxygen your body can use during peak exertion v is for volume usually
health usually measured in milliliters of oxygen per kilogram of bodyweight per minute o is for oxygen and max is for maximum
health maximum the better shape you re in the higher your vo max most adults are in the and range and endurance
health endurance athletes are often between and however unless you re a runner or cyclist training to break a record you probably
health probably don t need to know your vo max which is a good thing because you can only find out what
health what yours is by having a technician measure your oxygen intake during vigorous exercise typically on a treadmill or a stationary
health stationary bicycle abduction absolute fat active recovery adaptation adduction adenosine triphosphate atp aerobic after burn agonist amino acids anabolic steroids anaerobic

health lack of use barbell a free weight consisting of a long bar on which weight plates are placed it is normally
health normally lifted with both arms body composition the percentage of your body weight composed of fat compared to fat free mass
health mass carbohydrates organic compounds containing carbon hydrogen and oxygen they are a very effect fuel source for the body the different
health different types of carbohydrates include starches sugars and fibers carbohydrates contain four calories per gram glucose blood sugar is a carbohydrate

health as a bad fat implicated in promoting heart disease and stroke is a vital component in production of many hormones in
health in the body there are different types of cholesterol namely hdl and ldl hdl being the good form and ldl being
health being the bad form clean diet this refers to eating nutrient rich low fat meals concentric the lifting phase of an
health an exercise when the muscle shortens or contracts for example when you lift the weight in a bench press pressing it
health it from your chest to the lockout position that s the concentric or positive phase of the movement confident mindset the
health the state of being where you feel self reliant confident and strong deficiency a sub optimal level of one or more
health more nutrients that is essential for good health most often seen with vitamins a deficiency can be caused by poor nutrition
health nutrition increased bodily demands especially from intense training or stress or both diet food and drink regularly consumed by a person
health person often according to specific guidelines to improve physical condition dumbbell a free weight made up of a short handle on
health on which weight plates are placed these are normally lifted with one arm eccentric the lowering phase of an exercise when
health when the muscle lengthens for example lowering the weight to your chest during the bench press is the eccentric or negative
health negative portion of the exercise energy the capacity to do work energy harnessed is power energy zone the ability to obtain
health obtain more energy through increased fat burning exercising in the energy zone will give you unlimited energy enable you to burn
health burn more body fat and improve the quality of your life forever it is based on a number of scientifically proven
health proven concepts known to few people other than exercise professionals essential fatty acids efas fats our bodies can t make so
health so we must obtain them through our diets these fats which include linoleic acid are very important to hormone production as
health as well as cellular synthesis and integrity good sources of these fats are flaxseed oil and safflower oil fat one of
health of the macronutrients there are two types of fat saturated bad fat and unsaturated good fat fat free mass ffm the
health the part of the body not containing fat including bone muscle skin organs water hair and blood free day a day
health day when you must eat the foods you craved for the previous six days and must not exercise frequent feeding eating
health eating often throughout the day to work with your body not against it by eating at regular intervals throughout the day
health day approximately every two to three hours you can keep your metabolism elevated and energy levels stable fructose the main type
health type of sugar found in fruit it s sweeter than sucrose table sugar glucose the simplest sugar molecule it s also
health also the main sugar found in blood and is used as a basic fuel for the body glycogen the principal stored
health stored form of carbohydrate energy glucose which is reserved in muscles when your muscles are full of glycogen they look and
health and feel full gorging this refers to eating large amounts of food at one meal then waiting for many hours maybe
health maybe a full day before eating again this is also known as bingeing grazing this term refers to frequent feedings eating
health eating small amounts of food often hdl this stands for high intensity lipoprotein it s one of the subcategories of cholesterol
health cholesterol typically thought of as the good cholesterol you may be able to raise your hdl cholesterol levels by ingesting quality
health quality unsaturated fats like flaxseed oil exercise has also been shown to increase hdl levels intensity a measure of how much
health much force or energy is put forth during a task law of nature use it or lose it lean body mass
health mass lbm another term that describes fat free mass ldl this stands for low density lipoprotein and is subcategory of cholesterol
health cholesterol typically thought as the bad cholesterol levels of ldl cholesterol can be elevated by ingestion of saturated fats and a
health a lack of exercise metabolic rate the rate at which you convert energy stores into working energy in your body in
health in other words it s how fast your whole system runs the metabolic rate is controlled by a number of factors
health factors including muscle mass the greater your muscle mass the greater your metabolic rate calorie intake and exercise metabolism the use
health use of nutrients by the body it s the process by which substances come into the body and the rate at
health at which they are used minerals naturally occurring inorganic substances which are essential for human life which play a role in
health in many vital metabolic processes nutrients components of food that help nourish the body that is they provide energy or serve
health serve as building materials these nutrients include carbohydrates fats proteins vitamins minerals water etc portion the amount of carbohydrates or protein
health protein one should eat with each meal a portion is the size of the palm of your hand or clenched fist
health fist confident mindset the state of being where you feel self reliant confident and strong proteins proteins are the building blocks
health blocks of muscle enzymes and some hormones they are made up of amino acids and are essential for growth and repair
health repair in the body a gram of protein contains four calories those from animal sources contain the essential amino acids those
health those from vegetable sources contain some but not all of the essential amino acids the body to produce amino acids breaks
health breaks up proteins repetition the number of times you lift and lower a weight in one set of an exercise for
health for example if you lift and lower a weight times before setting the weight down you have completed reps in one
health one set resistance exercise working out with weights or using your body to resist some other force this includes a wide
health wide spectrum of motion from push ups to dumbbell curls rest period the amount of time you allow between sets and
health and exercises set group of reps lifting and lowering a weight of an exercise after which you take a brief rest
health rest period for example if you complete reps set the weight down complete eight more reps set the weight down again
health again and repeat for six more reps you have completed three sets of the exercise saturated fats these are bad fats
health fats they are called saturated because they contain no open spots on their carbon skeletons these bad fats have been shown
health shown to raise cholesterol levels in the body sources of these fats include animal foods and hydrogenated vegetable oils such as
health as margarine supplement this is a term used to describe a preparation such as a tablet pill or powder that contains
health contains nutrients supplements are used to help you achieve optimal nutrient intake universal law of reciprocation the more you help others
health others the more your life is enhanced vitamins organic compounds which are vital to life indispensable to bodily function and needed
health needed in minute amounts they are calorie free essential nutrients many of them function in coenzymes supporting a multitude of biological
