news to say that the united states has pursued diplomacy with north korea is a little bit misleading it did under the
news the clinton administration though neither side completely lived up to their obligations clinton didn t do what was promised nor did
news did north korea but they were making progress so when bush came into the presidency north korea had enough uranium or
news or plutonium for maybe one or two bombs but then very limited missile capacity during the bush years it s exploded
news exploded the reason is he immediately canceled the diplomacy and he s pretty much blocked it ever since they made a
news a very substantial agreement in september in which north korea agreed to eliminate its enrichment programs and nuclear development completely in
news in return the united states agreed to terminate the threats of attack and to begin moving towards the planning for the
news the provision of a light water reactor which had been promised under the framework agreement but the bush administration instantly undermined
news undermined it right away they canceled the international consortium that was planning for the light water reactor which was a way
news way of saying we re not going to agree to this agreement a couple of days later they started attacking the
news the financial transactions of various banks it was timed in such a way to make it clear that the united states
news states was not going to move towards its commitment to improve relations and of course it never withdrew the threats so
news so that was the end of the september agreement that one is now coming back just in the last few days
news days the way it s portrayed in the u s media is as usual with the government s party line that
news that north korea is now perhaps a little more amenable to accept the september proposal so there s some optimism if
news if you go across the atlantic to the financial times to review the same events they point out that an embattled
news embattled bush administration it s their phrase needs some kind of victory so maybe it ll be willing to move towards
news towards diplomacy it s a little more accurate i think if you look at the background but there is some minimal
news minimal sense of optimism about it if you look back over the record mdash and north korea is a horrible place
news place nobody is arguing about that mdash on this issue they ve been pretty rational it s been a kind of
news of tit for tat history if the united states is accommodating the north koreans become accommodating if the united states is
news is hostile they become hostile that s reviewed pretty well by leon sigal who s one of the leading specialists on
news on this in a recent issue of current history but that s been the general picture and we re now at
news at a place where there could be a settlement on north korea that s much less significant for the united states
news states than iran the iranian issue i don t think has much to do with nuclear weapons frankly nobody is saying
news saying iran should have nuclear weapons ndash nor should anybody else but the point in the middle east as distinct from
news from north korea is that this is center of the world s energy resources originally the british and secondarily the french
news french had dominated it but after the second world war it s been a u s preserve that s been an
news an axiom of u s foreign policy that it must control middle east energy resources it is not a matter of
news of access as people often say once the oil is on the seas it goes anywhere in fact if the united
news united states used no middle east oil it d have the same policies if we went on solar energy tomorrow it
news it d keep the same policies just look at the internal record or the logic of it the issue has always
news always been control control is the source of strategic power dick cheney declared in kazakhstan or somewhere that control over pipeline
news pipeline is a ldquo tool of intimidation and blackmail rdquo when we have control over the pipelines it s a tool
news tool of benevolence if other countries have control over the sources of energy and the distribution of energy then it is
news is a tool of intimidation and blackmail exactly as cheney said and that s been understood as far back as george
news george kennan and the early post war days when he pointed out that if the united states controls middle east resources
news resources it ll have veto power over its industrial rivals he was speaking particularly of japan but the point generalizes so
news so iran is a different situation it s part of the major energy system of the world shank so when the
news the united states considers a potential invasion you think it s under the premise of gaining control that is what the
news the united states will gain from attacking iran chomsky there are several issues in the case of iran one is simply
news simply that it is independent and independence is not tolerated sometimes it s called successful defiance in the internal record take
news take cuba a very large majority of the u s population is in favor of establishing diplomatic relations with cuba and
news and has been for a long time with some fluctuations and even part of the business world is in favor of
news of it too but the government won t allow it it s attributed to the florida vote but i don t
news t think that s much of an explanation i think it has to do with a feature of world affairs that
news that is insufficiently appreciated international affairs is very much run like the mafia the godfather does not accept disobedience even from
news from a small storekeeper who doesn t pay his protection money you have to have obedience otherwise the idea can spread
news spread that you don t have to listen to the orders and it can spread to important places if you look
news look back at the record what was the main reason for the u s attack on vietnam independent development can be
news be a virus that can infect others that s the way it s been put kissinger in this case referring to
news to allende in chile and with cuba it s explicit in the internal record arthur schlesinger presenting the report of the
news the latin american study group to incoming president kennedy wrote that the danger is the spread of the castro idea of
news of taking matters into your own hands which has a lot of appeal to others in the same region that suffer
news suffer from the same problems later internal documents charged cuba with successful defiance of u s policies going back years ndash
news ndash to the monroe doctrine and that can t be tolerated so there s kind of a state commitment to ensuring
news ensuring obedience going back to iran it s not only that it has substantial resources and that it s part of
news of the world s major energy system but it also defied the united states the united states as we know overthrew
news overthrew the parliamentary government installed a brutal tyrant was helping him develop nuclear power in fact the very same programs that

news in the s as long as the shah was in power but then the iranians overthrew him and they kept u
news u s hostages for several hundred days and the united states immediately turned to supporting saddam hussein and his war against

news the usa has soared to unprecedented heights currently approaching trillion driven largely by the housing bubble with house prices rising on
news on average during q last year the average american spent more than he earned again representing the lowest personal savings rate
news rate since the great depression figures now suggest that the average us consumer has accumulated in personal debts add to this
news this the fact that the usa has the largest credit card debt in the world as well as ever increasing medical
news medical bills and it isn t hard to see why more people are filing for bankruptcy many financial analysts are extremely
news extremely worried since the usa is buying more from abroad than it exports further compounding the problem of national debt japan

news care costs which eat up large portions of disposable income particularly for low income families alternative poverty measures that account for
news for these shortcomings typically inflate or deflate official poverty statistics but many of those alternative measures show the same kind of
news of long term trends as the official poverty data robert rector a senior researcher with the heritage foundation a conservative think

news a collateralised debt obligation is a financial structure that groups individual loans bonds or assets in a portfolio which can then

news business equity is how much all of the shares put together are worth in a house your equity is the amount

news or oil contracts will fall they borrow the asset from another investor and then sell it in the relevant market the

news rational libertarian will grant that absolutism is not very useful usually at about the same time they get their learner s
news s permit but there are some libertarians who remain unswayed by such ugly facts whether through persistent ignorance or sociopathy or
news or a mixture of the two they hold as an article of near religious faith that they derive no benefit from
news from the modern regulatory apparatus that they could not duplicate on their own with the homebrew fda they have in their
news their garage or even worse they manifestly hold the welfare of others as far less important than their own profit and
news and comfort as an example of that last witness this notable bay area libertarian a meat packing magnate who did not
news not want the law to see how his sausage was made in a cutthroat economic free for all with the mass
news mass of people on the bottom and a handful of ruthless machiavellian princes at the top each one of these goobers
news goobers thinks it s inevitable that he gender specificity deliberate will inevitably become one of the princes you cannot argue these
news these people into rationality nor can you persuade them by logic to show compassion for their fellow humans the best you
news you can do is to make their heads explode with simple fact based declarative sentences i ve found a few reliable
news reliable ways to do so which i will describe here briefly you might know of others feel free to describe them
news them in comments using these sentences will cause libertarian cultists to sputter stammer and occasionally start to think worst case scenario
news scenario these sentences will usually at least cause them to shut up and it s hard to downplay the importance of
news of that in making your typical day a bit rosier libertarian cranial detonation technique mentioning libertarian history most american libertarians have
news have precious little grasp of the history of their political philosophy they seem to think that the libertarian school of thought
news thought sprang fully formed like athena from ayn rand s beetled brow with robert heinlein as attending midwife libertarianism s true
news true origins however unsettle most libertarians to the point where the mere acceptance of that history often starts those rusty old
news old mental gears grinding again to wit and here is tactical nuclear sentence number one libertarianism originated in the philosophy of
news of a left wing french political philosopher who also influenced karl marx the french philosopher in question is as some of
news of you have guessed and with whose description a few of you are no doubt ready to quibble pierre joseph proudhon
news proudhon who famously penned the libertarians sekrit motto property is theft of course unlike modern libertarians proudhon meant that as a
news a condemnation among the pre marxist political thinkers strongly influenced by proudhon was johann kaspar schmidt who under the pen name
news name max stirner wrote one of the first true capital l libertarian texts der einzige und sein eigentum which can be
news be translated either as the ego and its own or more and more tellingly the individual and his property stirner became
news became a nucleus of a nascent school of political thought then called individualist anarchism whose inheritance tax free heirs include ludwig
news ludwig von mises the austrian and chicago schools murray rothbard alan greenspan and so on libertarian cranial detonation technique mentioning libertarianism
news libertarianism s siblings but proudhon and to a certain extent stirner also influenced a number of political philosophers and activists who
news who extended the anarchist critique of power relations to the economic sphere bakunin tolstoy kropotkin goldman malatesta etc the early twentieth
news twentieth century saw a mass anarchist movement in the industrial world and though that got pretty much squelched the philosophy lived
news lived on to influence much of the modern progressive left despite the libertarians historically illiterate insistence that socialism is synonymous with
news with totalitarianism much of current left thought is libertarian at its root which provides us with the useful sentence i m
news m a libertarian socialist of course it s easier to say that if you actually are one but the definitions of
news of both adjectives are broad enough to encompass a range of people from noam chomsky to paul wellstone in fact the
news the boundary between libertarian socialist and liberal democrat is pretty much impossible to delineate with any kind of precision people who
news who are libertarian socialists in the long view are often liberal democrats in the moment what s the more libertarian way
news way of running the world coming up with ever evolving procedures by which the largest number of people possible have the
news the largest amount of input possible into the policy by which we run the world moderated by recognizing certain expertise and
news and the efficiency of delegating some decision making which is a bright eyed and optimistic way of describing the mission of
news of liberal democracy or letting the people who are best at accumulating money bribe bully and blackmail their way into running
news running huge sections of the world libertarian cranial detonation technique mentioning libertarianism s blindspot that accumulation of serious political power is

news and sunni muslims to undermine iran which is predominantly shiite the bush administration has decided in effect to reconfigure its priorities

news sunni in clandestine operations that are intended to weaken hezbollah the shiite organization that is backed by iran the u s
news s has also taken part in clandestine operations aimed at iran and its ally syria a by product of these activities

news aishat on a bed in her own house and shot five mm bullets into her these bullets weighted at the edges
news edges have been forbidden by all international conventions as inhumane in the west politkovskaya s honesty brought her a measure of

news was articulate attractive and accomplished she was barred from appearing on television which is the only way the vast majority of

news much for herself as for any reader i m sure this has to be done for one simple reason as contemporaries
news contemporaries of this war we will be held responsible for it the classic soviet excuse of not being there and not
news not taking part in anything personally won t work so i want you to know the truth then you ll be
news be free of cynicism on the afternoon of october politkovskaya drove to a supermarket near her mother s flat on the

news the store later showed politkovskaya was not alone a young woman and a tall slender man whose face was obscured by
news by a baseball cap lurked in the aisles as she shopped when politkovskaya finished she drove home in her silver vaz
news vaz and parked a few feet from the entrance to her building she took the tiny elevator up to her flat
news flat on the seventh floor and dropped two bags of groceries at the door then she went down to fetch the
news the rest of her parcels when the elevator opened on the ground floor her killer was waiting he shot her four
news four times the first two bullets piercing her heart and lungs the third shattering her shoulder with a force that drove
news drove politkovskaya back into the elevator he then administered what is referred to in moscow where contract killings have become routine
news routine as the kontrolnyi vystrel the control shot he fired a bullet into her head from inches away then he dropped
news dropped his weapon a plastic mm makarov pistol whose serial number had been filed away and slipped into the darkening afternoon

news boris yeltsin journalists have been murdered in russia nearly all the deaths took place in strange circumstances and none of them

news convinced he was poisoned on july paul klebnikov the founding editor of the russian edition of forbes who had made powerful
news powerful enemies by investigating corruption among russian business tycoons was shot dead as he left his moscow office the attacks have
news have not been limited to journalists in september viktor yushchenko a candidate for president of ukraine who helped lead the orange
news orange revolution and who was vigorously opposed by putin barely survived a poisoning doctors determined that he had been given the
news the deadly chemical dioxin which left his face disfigured and his health severely impaired since then two members of the duma

news the country of banks that were little more than fronts for organised crime and just a few weeks ago in an
news an execution that could have been planned by al capone movladi baisarov a former chechen special forces officer who had come
news come to be seen by the prime minister ramzan kadyrov as a rival was gunned down on leninsky prospekt one of
news of moscow s busiest thoroughfares a series of control shots were administered in front of scores of witnesses including high ranking
news ranking members of the police force no arrests have been made four weeks after politkovskaya died alexander litvinenko a little known
news known former kgb agent who had been imprisoned by putin and had then defected to england fell gravely ill in london
news london like many others including politkovskaya litvinenko had accused the russian president of creating a pretext for the second chechen war
news war in by blowing up buildings in moscow and then blaming chechen separatists for the attacks putin s decisive response to
news to those acts of terrorism propelled him toward immense and lasting popularity he was outraged by litvinenko s accusation and equally
news equally angered that litvinenko had fallen into the orbit of boris berezovsky one of putin s most despised enemies berezovsky a
news a shady billionaire oligarch wielded huge power in the yeltsin years helped bring putin to yeltsin s attention and even played
news played a major role in persuading him to assume the presidency once putin took power though berezovsky found himself shut off
news off from the kremlin he accused putin of turning his back on yeltsin s reforms and was driven from the country
news country litvinenko subsequently charged that his fsb superiors had ordered him to kill berezovsky on his deathbed he accused putin of
news of killing him he also blamed putin for politkovskaya s death the manner of litvinenko s poisoning was obscure almost until
news until the moment he died at first doctors thought he had an unusual bacterial infection then they said that his symptoms
news symptoms pointed toward rat poison when his immune system started to fail they thought it more likely the poison was a
news a radioactive form of thallium which had been used by the kgb nearly years earlier in a failed attempt to assassinate
news assassinate nikolai khokhlov an agent who had refused to comply with an order to kill a prominent russian dissident finally just
news just hours before litvinenko died the doctors provided a definitive and even more improbable diagnosis he had been poisoned with polonium
news polonium a rare radioactive isotope a millionth of a gram is enough to destroy a person s bodily organs litvinenko s
news s murder was the first known case of nuclear terrorism perpetrated against an individual in moscow a city given to conspiracy
news conspiracy theories people could speak of little else putin had acted to silence a vocal traitor no putin s enemies did
news did it to destroy the image of the kremlin and gain leverage in the presidential campaign putin s allies did it
news it so that they could use the affair as a convenient excuse to ignore the constitution and secure him a third
news third term the jews did it because litvinenko had converted to islam muslim extremists did it because litvinenko had reneged on
news on a promise to supply parts for a dirty bomb berezovsky did it to embarrass putin the kremlin even suggested that

news was no proof for any of these assertions last july however the duma passed a law introduced by the kremlin to

news has become an obsession the new law explained everything this guy is a kgb guy berezovsky told me one afternoon over

news kill opponents abroad his voice rose and he shrugged and then he glanced at me as if to say how could

news is russia and nobody agrees to kill without the signature of somebody more important who gave the order the kremlin has

news d security initiative war must entail some degree of confrontation using weapons and other military technology and equipment by armed forces
news forces employing military tactics and operational art within a broad military strategy subject to military logistics studies of war by military
news military theorists throughout military history have sought to identify the philosophy of war and to reduce it to a military science
news science ruins of guernica the spanish civil war was one of europe s bloodiest and most brutal civil wars modern military
news military science considers several factors before a national defence policy is created to allow a war to commence the environment in
news in the area s of combat operations the posture that national forces will adopt on the commencement of a war and
news and the type of warfare that troops will be engaged in asymmetric warfare is a conflict between two populations of drastically
news drastically different levels of military capability or size asymmetric conflicts often result in guerrilla tactics being used to overcome the sometimes
news sometimes vast gaps in technology and force size biological warfare also known as germ warfare is the use of biological toxins
news toxins or infectious agents such as bacteria viruses and fungi with the intent to kill or incapacitate humans animals or plants
news plants chemical warfare involves the intentional use of chemicals in combat poison gas as a chemical weapon was principally used during
news during world war i and resulted in an estimated million casualties including civilians tens of thousands or more civilians and military
news military personnel died from chemical weapon effects such as scarring of the lungs skin damage and cerebral damage in the years
news years after the great war ended various treaties have sought to ban its further use non lethal chemical weapons such as
news as tear gas and pepper spray are widely used sometimes with deadly effect civil war is a war where the forces
news forces in conflict belong to the same nation or political entity and are vying for control of or independence from that
news that nation or political entity conventional warfare is an attempt to reduce the enemy s capability through open battle it is
news is a declared war between existing states in which nuclear biological or chemical weapons are not used or only see limited
news limited deployment in support of conventional military goals and maneuvers cyberwarfare involves the actions by a nation state or international organization
news organization to attack and attempt to damage another nation s computers or information networks globalizing war refers to a form of
news of war which extends beyond the national or regional boundaries of the immediate combatants to have implications for the whole planet
news planet an obvious example of this form of war is world war ii but others such as the vietnam war also
news also qualify globalizing war thus includes world war with that category tending to be restricted by convention to the two main
news main examples transnational war a cognate concept refers to wars fought locally but with implications or hostilities across the boundaries of
news of nation states total war is warfare by any means possible disregarding the laws of war placing no limits on legitimate
news legitimate military targets using weapons and tactics that result in significant civilian casualties or demanding a war effort that requires significant
news significant sacrifices by the friendly civilian population nuclear warfare is warfare in which nuclear weapons are the primary or a major
news major method of coercing the capitulation of the other side as opposed to a supporting tactical or strategic role in a
news a conventional conflict unconventional warfare the opposite of conventional warfare is an attempt to achieve military victory through acquiescence capitulation or
news or clandestine support for one side of an existing conflict war of aggression is a war for conquest or gain rather
news rather than self defense this can be the basis of war crimes under customary international law destuctive weapen seem useless as

news goose egg a couple of hours into our schlitterbahn experience we got on a bus to leave the x old section

news so much for the chance of rain x i commented by the time we got to our destination lightning sightings had

news of letting up so we began heading back to our vehicles a hundred yards into the parking lot we passing a
news a tree that had apparently been split in two during the storm whether by lightning or wind i m not sure
news sure not but a few yards later there was a distinct thud and the husband of the couple accompanying us cried
news cried out as a near racquetball sized hunk of ice rebounded off of his head and onto the concrete soon similarly
news similarly sized hail was falling all around us as everyone scampered for cover some cowered under overturned trashcans while others were
news were more fortunate and made it indoors the hail rain and lightning eventually subsided but the most alarming news was waiting
news waiting on cell phone voicemail a friend who lived in the area had called frantically knowing we were at the park
news park as the local news was reporting multiple people had been by struck by lightning at schlitterbahn during the storm x
news x so much for the chance of rain x i repeated testing the skepticism after that experience i gave up using
news using online weather forecasts actually any weather forecast for more than getting a reasonable idea of the x temperature decade x
news x for the next day i ve recently begun to be a little skeptical of my own skepticism however what if
news if i was the victim of a freak waterpark occurrence and was missing out on the typically reliable weather information online
news online using a spreadsheet observed data and straightforward statistics i was set to find out my plan was to record the
news the weather forecasts of some of the most popular internet weather sites as well as actual temperatures and then to analyze
news analyze the data to determine each site s accuracy i would then be able to draw supported conclusions to apply to
news to future use of internet weather forecasts if any data mining internet weather forecasts doing an internet search for various weather
news weather related keywords and then cross referencing to avoid duplication i selected the top ten weather forecast sites to be included
news included in my survey using their google toolbar pagerank pr additionally i selected houston texas as the location and the weather
news weather channel as my x actual temperature x source the national weather service pr bbc weather pr the weather channel pr
news pr the weather underground pr intellicast pr cnn weather pr msn weather pr the weather network pr unisys pr accuweather pr
news pr actual as reported on weather com then on a daily basis i recorded the predicted low and high temperatures on

news see current traffic incidents from the yahoo api for more information see the about page absolute humidity a type of humidity

news the water vapor it is usually expressed in grams per cubic meter absolute instability when the lapse rate of a column

news or not the air is dry or saturated instability absolute temperature scale a temperature scale with a freezing point of k
news k kelvin and a boiling point of k kelvin temperature scale absolute zero considered to be the point at which theoretically
news theoretically no molecular activity exists or the temperature at which the volume of a perfect gas vanishes the value is kelvin
news kelvin celsius and fahrenheit absorption the process in which incident radiant energy is retained by a substance the absorbed radiation is
news is then transformed into molecular energy abyssal plain the flat gently sloping or nearly level region of the sea floor adiabatic
news adiabatic process a thermodynamic change of state in a system in which there is no transfer of heat or mass across
news across the boundaries of the system in this process compression will result in warming and expansion will result in cooling advection
news advection the horizontal transfer of any property in the atmosphere by the movement of air wind examples include heat and moisture
news moisture advection advection fog fog that develops when warm moist air moves over a colder surface cooling that air to below
news below its dew point s arctic sea smoke and sea fog advisory statements that are issued by the national weather service

news condition causing temporary restrictions to visibility afos acronym for automation of field operations and services it is the computer system that
news that links national weather service offices together for weather data transmission air this is considered the mixture of gases that make
news make up the earth s atmosphere the principal gases that compose dry air are nitrogen n at oxygen o at argon
news argon a at and carbon dioxide co at one of the most important constituents of air and most important gases in
news in meteorology is water vapor h o air mass an extensive body of air throughout which the horizontal temperature and moisture
news moisture characteristics are similar air mass thunderstorm a thunderstorm that is produced by convection within an unstable air mass through an
news an instability mechanism such thunderstorms normally occur within a tropical or warm moist air mass during the summer afternoon as the
news the result of afternoon heating and dissipate soon after sunset such thunderstorms are not generally associated with fronts and are less
news less likely to become severe than other types of thunderstorms however that does not preclude them from having brief heavy downpours
news downpours air pollution the soiling of the atmosphere by contaminants to the point that may cause injury to health property plant
news plant or animal life or prevent the use and enjoyment of the outdoors air quality standards the maximum level which will
news will be permitted for a given pollutant primary standards are to be sufficiently stringent to protect the public health secondary standards
news standards must protect the public welfare including property and aesthetics alaskan winds the downslope air flow that blows through the alaskan
news alaskan valleys it is usually given local names such as knik matanuska pruga stikine taku take turnagain or williwaw albedo the
news the ratio of the amount of radiation reflected from an object s surface compared to the amount that strikes it this
news this varies according to the texture color and expanse of the object s surface and is reported in percentage surfaces with
news with high albedo include sand and snow while low albedo rates include forests and freshly turned earth dave s dictionary alberta
news alberta clipper a fast moving snow producing weather system that originates in the lee of the canadian rockies it moves quickly
news quickly across the northern united states often bring gusty winds and cold arctic air aleutian low a semi permanent subpolar area
news area of low pressure located in the gulf of alaska near the aleutian islands it is a generating area for storms
news storms and migratory lows often reach maximum intensity in this area it is most active during the late fall to late
news late spring during the summer it is weaker retreating towards the north pole and becoming almost nonexistent during this time the
news the north pacific high pressure system dominates icelandic low altimeter an instrument used to determine the altitude of an object with
news with respect to a fixed level the type normally used by meteorologists measures the altitude with respect to sea level pressure
news pressure altimeter setting the pressure value to which an aircraft altimeter scale is set so that it will indicate the altitude
news altitude above mean sea level of an aircraft on the ground at the location for which the value was determined altitude
news altitude in meteorology the measure of a height of an airborne object in respect to a constant pressure surface or above
news above mean sea level altocumulus composed of flattened thick gray globular masses this middle cloud genus is primarily made of water
news water droplets in the mid latitudes cloud bases are usually found between and feet a defining characteristic is that it often
news often appears as a wavy billowy layer of cloud giving it the nickname of sheep or woolpack clouds sometimes confused with
news with cirrocumulus clouds its elements individual clouds have a larger mass and cast a shadow on other elements it may form
news form several sub types such as altocumulus castellanus or altocumulus lenticularis virga may also fall from these clouds altocumulus castellanus a
news a middle cloud with vertical development that forms from altocumulus clouds it is composed primarily of ice crystals in its higher
news higher portions and characterized by its turrets protuberances or crenelated tops its formation indicates instability and turbulence at the altitudes of
news of occurrence altostratus this middle cloud genus is composed of water droplets and sometimes ice crystals in the mid latitudes cloud
news cloud bases are generally found between and feet white to gray in color it can create a fibrous veil or sheet
news sheet sometimes obscuring the sun or moon it is a good indicator of precipitation as it often precedes a storm system
news system virga often falls from these clouds american meteorological society an organization whose membership promotes the education and professional advancement of
news of the atmospheric hydrologic and oceanographic sciences for further information contact the ams national weather association anabatic wind a wind that
news that is created by air flowing uphill valley breezes produced by local daytime heating are an example of these winds the
news the opposite of a katabatic wind anemometer an instrument that measures the speed or force of the wind dave s dictionary
news dictionary aneroid barometer an instrument for measuring the atmospheric pressure it registers the change in the shape of an evacuated metal
news metal cell to measure variations on the atmospheric pressure the aneroid is a thin walled metal capsule or cell usually made
news made of phosphor bronze or beryllium copper the scales on the glass cover measure pressure in both inches and millibars mercurial
news mercurial barometer anomalous propagation this refers to the non standard propagation of a beam of energy radio or radar under certain
news certain atmospheric conditions appearing as false non precipitation echoes may be referred to as a p antarctic of or relating to
news to the area around the geographic south pole from south to the antarctic circle at approximately south latitude including the continent
news continent of antarctica along the antarctic circle the sun does not set on the day of the summer solstice approximately december
news december st and does not rise on the day of the winter solstice approximately june st antarctic ocean although not officially
news officially recognized as a separate ocean body it is commonly applied to those portions of the atlantic pacific and indian oceans
news oceans that reach the antarctic continent on their southern extremes anticyclone a relative pressure maximum an area of pressure that has
news has diverging winds and a rotation opposite to the earth s rotation this is clockwise the northern hemisphere and counter clockwise
news clockwise in the southern hemisphere it is the opposite of an area of low pressure or a cyclone high pressure anvil
news anvil the upper portion of a cumulonimbus cloud that becomes flat and spread out sometimes for hundreds of miles downstream from
news from the parent cloud it may look smooth or fibrous but in shape it resembles a blacksmith s anvil it indicates
news indicates the mature or decaying stage of a thunderstorm aphelion the point on the earth s orbit that is farthest from
news from the sun although the position is part of a year cycle currently it occurs around july when the earth is
news is about million miles farther from the sun than at perihelion this term can be applied to any other celestial body
news body in orbit around the sun it is the opposite of perihelion apogee the point farthest from the earth on the
news the moon s orbit this term can be applied to any other body orbiting the earth such as satellites it is
news is the opposite of perigee arctic of or relating to the area around the geographic north pole from north to the
news the arctic circle at approximately north latitude arctic air mass an air mass that develops around the arctic it is characterized
news characterized by being cold from surface to great heights the boundary of this air mass is often defined by the arctic
news arctic front a semi permanent semi continuous feature when this air mass moves from its source region it may become more

physics physics natural philosophy and a natural science that involves the study of matter and its motion through space and time along
physics along with related concepts such as energy and force general analysis of nature conducted in order to understand how the universe
physics universe behaves physics is one of the oldest astronomy physics was a part of natural philosophy along with chemistry certain branches
physics branches of mathematics and biology but during the scientific revolution in the th century the natural sciences emerged as unique research
physics research programs in their own right physics intersects with many interdisciplinary areas of research such as biophysics and quantum chemistry and
physics and the boundaries of physics are not rigidly defined new ideas in physics often explain the fundamental mechanisms of other sciences
physics sciences while opening new avenues of research in areas such as mathematics and philosophy physics also makes significant contributions through advances
physics advances in new technologies that arise from theoretical breakthroughs for example advances in the understanding of electromagnetism or nuclear physics led
physics led directly to the development of new products which have dramatically transformed modern day society such as television computers domestic appliances
physics appliances and nuclear weapons advances in thermodynamics led to the development of industrialization and advances in mechanics inspired the development of
physics of calculus natural philosophy has its origins in greece during the archaic period bce bce when pre socratic philosophers like thales
physics thales rejected non naturalistic explanations for natural phenomena and proclaimed that every event had a natural cause they proposed ideas verified
physics verified by reason and observation and many of their hypotheses proved successful in experiment for example atomism classical physics became a
physics a separate science when early modern europeans used these experimental and quantitative methods to discover what are now considered to be
physics be the laws of physics kepler galileo and more specifically newton discovered and unified the different laws of motion during the
physics the industrial revolution as energy needs increased so did research which led to the discovery of new laws in thermodynamics chemistry
physics chemistry and electromagnetics modern physics started with the works of max planck in quantum theory and einstein in relativity and continued
physics continued in quantum mechanics pioneered by heisenberg schr dinger and paul dirac n many ways physics stems from ancient greek philosophy
physics philosophy from thales first attempt to characterize matter to democritus deduction that matter ought to reduce to an invariant state the
physics the ptolemaic astronomy of a crystalline firmament and aristotle s book physics an early book on physics which attempted to analyze
physics analyze and define motion from a philosophical point of view various greek philosophers advanced their own theories of nature physics was
physics was known as natural philosophy until the late th century by the th century physics was realized as a discipline distinct
physics distinct from philosophy and the other sciences physics as with the rest of science relies on philosophy of science to give
physics give an adequate description of the scientific method the scientific method employs a priori reasoning as well as a posteriori reasoning
physics reasoning and the use of bayesian inference to measure the validity of a given theory the development of physics has answered
physics answered many questions of early philosophers but has also raised new questions study of the philosophical issues surrounding physics the philosophy
physics philosophy of physics involves issues such as the nature of space and time determinism and metaphysical outlooks such as empiricism naturalism
physics naturalism and realism many physicists have about the philosophical implications of their work for instance laplace who championed causal determinism and
physics and erwin schr dinger who wrote on quantum mechanics the mathematical physicist roger penrose has been called a platonist by stephen
physics stephen hawking a view penrose discusses in his book the road to reality hawking refers to himself as an unashamed reductionist
physics reductionist and issue with penrose s views though physics deals with a wide variety of systems certain theories are used by
physics by all physicists each of these theories were experimentally tested numerous times and found correct as an approximation of nature within
physics within a certain domain of validity for instance the theory of classical mechanics accurately describes the motion of objects provided they
physics they are much larger than atoms and moving at much less than the speed of light these theories continue to be
physics be areas of active research and a remarkable aspect of classical mechanics known as chaos was discovered in the th century
physics century three centuries after the original formulation of classical mechanics by isaac newton these central theories are important tools for research
physics research into more specialized topics and any physicist regardless of his or her specialization is expected to be literate in them
physics them these include classical mechanics quantum mechanics thermodynamics and statistical mechanics electromagnetism and special relativity classical physics main article classical physics
physics physics classical physics includes the traditional branches and topics that were recognized and well developed before the beginning of the th
physics th century classical mechanics acoustics optics thermodynamics and electromagnetism classical mechanics is concerned with bodies acted on by forces and bodies
physics bodies in motion and may be divided into statics study of the forces on a body or bodies at rest kinematics
physics kinematics study of motion without regard to its causes and dynamics study of motion and the forces that affect it mechanics
physics mechanics may also be divided into solid mechanics and fluid mechanics known together as continuum mechanics the latter including such branches
physics branches as hydrostatics hydrodynamics aerodynamics and pneumatics acoustics the study of sound is often considered a branch of mechanics because sound
physics sound is due to the motions of the particles of air or other medium through which sound waves can travel and
physics and thus can be explained in terms of the laws of mechanics among the important modern branches of acoustics is ultrasonics
physics ultrasonics the study of sound waves of very high frequency beyond the range of human hearing optics the study of light
physics light is concerned not only with visible light but also with infrared and ultraviolet radiation which exhibit all of the phenomena
physics phenomena of visible light except visibility e g reflection refraction interference diffraction dispersion and polarization of light heat is a form
physics form of energy the internal energy possessed by the particles of which a substance is composed thermodynamics deals with the relationships
physics relationships between heat and other forms of energy electricity and magnetism have been studied as a single branch of physics since
physics since the intimate connection between them was discovered in the early th century an electric current gives rise to a magnetic
physics magnetic field and a changing magnetic field induces an electric current electrostatics deals with electric charges at rest electrodynamics with moving
physics moving charges and magnetostatics with magnetic poles at rest classical physics is generally concerned with matter and energy on the normal
physics normal scale of observation while much of modern physics is concerned with the behavior of matter and energy under extreme conditions
physics conditions or on the very large or very small scale for example atomic and nuclear physics studies matter on the smallest
physics smallest scale at which chemical elements can be identified the physics of elementary particles is on an even smaller scale as
physics as it is concerned with the most basic units of matter this branch of physics is also known as high energy
physics energy physics because of the extremely high energies necessary to produce many types of particles in large particle accelerators on this
physics this scale ordinary commonsense notions of space time matter and energy are no longer valid the two chief theories of modern
physics modern physics present a different picture of the concepts of space time and matter from that presented by classical physics quantum
physics quantum theory is concerned with the discrete rather than continuous nature of many phenomena at the atomic and subatomic level and
physics and with the complementary aspects of particles and waves in the description of such phenomena the theory of relativity is concerned
physics concerned with the description of phenomena that take place in a frame of reference that is in motion with respect to
physics to an observer the special theory of relativity is concerned with relative uniform motion in a straight line and the general
physics general theory of relativity with accelerated motion and its connection with gravitation both quantum theory and the theory of relativity find
physics find applications in all areas of modern physics while physics aims to discover universal laws its theories lie in explicit domains
physics domains of applicability loosely speaking the laws of classical physics accurately describe systems whose important length scales are greater than the
physics the atomic scale and whose motions are much slower than the speed of light outside of this domain observations do not
physics not match their predictions albert einstein contributed the framework of special relativity which replaced notions of absolute time and space with
physics with spacetime and allowed an accurate description of systems whose components have speeds approaching the speed of light max planck erwin
physics erwin schr dinger and others introduced quantum mechanics a probabilistic notion of particles and interactions that allowed an accurate description of
physics of atomic and subatomic scales later quantum field theory unified quantum mechanics and special relativity general relativity allowed for a dynamical
physics dynamical curved spacetime with which highly massive systems and the large scale structure of the universe can be well described general
physics general relativity has not yet been unified with the other fundamental descriptions several candidate theories of quantum gravity are being developed
physics developed mathematics is the language used for compact description of the order in nature especially the laws of physics this was
physics was noted and advocated by pythagoras plato galileo and newton physics theories use mathematics to obtain order and provide precise formulas
physics formulas precise or d solutions quantitative results and predictions experiment results in physics are numerical measurements technologies based on mathematics like
physics like computation have made computational physics an active area of research the distinction between mathematics and physics is clear cut but
physics but not always obvious especially in mathematical physics ontology is a prerequisite for physics but not for mathematics it means physics
physics physics is ultimately concerned with descriptions of the real world while mathematics is concerned with abstract patterns even beyond the real
physics real world thus physics statements are synthetic while math statements are analytic mathematics contains hypotheses while physics contains theories mathematics statements
physics statements have to be only logically true while predictions of physics statements must match observed and experimental data the distinction is
physics is clear cut but not always obvious for example mathematical physics is the application of mathematics in physics its methods are
physics are mathematical but its subject is physical the problems in this field start with a math model of a physical situation
physics situation and a math description of a physical law every math statement used for solution has a hard to find physical
physics physical meaning the final mathematical solution has an easier to find meaning because it is what the solver is looking for
physics for physics is a branch of fundamental science not practical science physics is also called the fundamental science because the subject

physics physics for example chemistry studies properties structures and reactions of matter chemistry s focus on the atomic scale distinguishes it from

physics econophysics and sociophysics research scientific method physicists use the scientific method to test the validity of a physical theory using a
physics a methodical approach to compare the implications of the theory in question with the associated conclusions drawn from experiments and observations
physics observations conducted to test it experiments and observations are collected and compared with the predictions and hypotheses made by a theory
physics theory thus aiding in the determination or the validity invalidity of the theory a scientific law is a concise verbal or
physics or mathematical statement of a relation that expresses a fundamental principle of a theory like newton s law of universal gravitation
physics gravitation theory and experiment theorists seek to develop mathematical models that both agree with existing experiments and successfully predict future results
physics results while experimentalists devise and perform experiments to test theoretical predictions and explore new phenomena although theory and experiment are developed
physics developed separately they are strongly dependent upon each other progress in physics frequently comes about when experimentalists make a discovery that
physics that existing theories cannot explain or when new theories generate experimentally testable predictions which inspire new experiments physicists who work at

physics work to relate them to fundamental theory theoretical physics has historically taken inspiration from philosophy electromagnetism was unified this way beyond
physics beyond the known universe the field of theoretical physics also deals with hypothetical issues such as parallel universes a multiverse and
physics and higher dimensions theorists invoke these ideas in hopes of solving particular problems with existing theories they then explore the consequences
physics consequences of these ideas and work toward making testable predictions experimental physics informs and is informed by engineering and technology experimental
physics experimental physicists involved in basic research design and perform experiments with equipment such as particle accelerators and lasers whereas those involved
physics involved in applied research often work in industry developing technologies such as magnetic resonance imaging mri and transistors feynman has noted
physics noted that experimentalists may seek areas which are not well explored by theorists physics covers a wide range of phenomena from
physics from elementary particles such as quarks neutrinos and electrons to the largest superclusters of galaxies included in these phenomena are the
physics the most basic objects composing all other things therefore physics is sometimes called the fundamental science physics aims to describe the
physics the various phenomena that occur in nature in terms of simpler phenomena thus physics aims to both connect the things observable
physics observable to humans to root causes and then connect these causes together for example the ancient chinese observed that certain rocks
physics rocks lodestone were attracted to one another by some invisible force this effect was later called magnetism and was first rigorously
physics rigorously studied in the th century a little earlier than the chinese the ancient greeks knew of other objects such as
physics as amber that when rubbed with fur would cause a similar invisible attraction between the two this was also first studied
physics studied rigorously in the th century and came to be called electricity thus physics had come to understand two observations of
physics of nature in terms of some root cause electricity and magnetism however further work in the th century revealed that these
physics these two forces were just two different aspects of one force electromagnetism this process of unifying forces continues today and electromagnetism
physics electromagnetism and the weak nuclear force are now considered to be two aspects of the electroweak interaction physics hopes to find
physics find an ultimate reason theory of everything for why nature is as it is see section current research below for more
physics more information research fields contemporary research in physics can be broadly divided into condensed matter physics atomic molecular and optical physics
physics physics particle physics astrophysics geophysics and biophysics some physics departments also support research in physics since the th century the individual
physics individual fields of physics have become increasingly specialized and today most physicists work in a single field for their entire careers
physics careers universalists such as albert einstein and lev landau who worked in multiple fields of physics are now very rare condensed
physics condensed matter physics is the field of physics that deals with the macroscopic physical properties of matter in particular it is
physics is concerned with the condensed phases that appear whenever the number of particles in a system is extremely large and the
physics the interactions between them are strong the most familiar examples of condensed phases are solids and liquids which arise from the
physics the bonding and electromagnetic force between atoms more exotic condensed phases include the superfluid and the bose einstein condensate found in
physics in certain atomic systems at very low temperature the superconducting phase exhibited by conduction electrons in certain materials and the ferromagnetic
physics ferromagnetic and antiferromagnetic phases of spins on atomic lattices condensed matter physics is by far the largest field of contemporary physics
physics physics historically condensed matter physics grew out of solid state physics which is now considered one of its main subfields the
physics the term condensed matter physics was apparently coined by philip anderson when he renamed his research group previously solid state theory
physics theory in in the division of solid state physics of the american physical society was renamed as the division of condensed
physics condensed matter physics condensed matter physics has a large overlap with chemistry materials science nanotechnology and engineering atomic molecular and optical
physics optical physics main article atomic molecular and optical physics atomic molecular and optical physics amo is the study of matter matter
physics matter and light matter interactions on the scale of single atoms and molecules the three areas are grouped together because of
physics of their interrelationships the similarity of methods used and the commonality of the energy scales that are relevant all three areas
physics areas include both classical semi classical and quantum treatments they can treat their subject from a microscopic view in contrast to
physics to a macroscopic view atomic physics studies the electron shells of atoms current research focuses on activities in quantum control cooling
physics cooling and trapping of atoms and ions citation needed low temperature collision dynamics and the effects of electron correlation on structure
physics structure and dynamics atomic physics is influenced by the nucleus see e g hyperfine splitting but intra nuclear phenomena such as
physics as fission and fusion are considered part of high energy physics molecular physics focuses on multi atomic structures and their internal
physics internal and external interactions with matter and light optical physics is distinct from optics in that it tends to focus not
physics not on the control of classical light fields by macroscopic objects but on the fundamental properties of optical fields and their
physics their interactions with matter in the microscopic realm high energy physics particle physics and nuclear physics main articles particle physics and
physics and nuclear physics a simulated event in the cms detector of the large hadron collider featuring a possible appearance of the
physics the higgs boson particle physics is the study of the elementary constituents of matter and energy and the interactions between them
physics them in addition particle physicists design and develop the high energy accelerators detectors and computer programs necessary for this research the
physics the field is also called high energy physics because many elementary particles do not occur naturally but are created only during
physics during high energy collisions of other particles currently the interactions of elementary particles and fields are described by the standard model
physics model the model accounts for the known particles of matter quarks and leptons that interact via the strong weak and electromagnetic
physics electromagnetic fundamental forces dynamics are described in terms of matter particles exchanging gauge bosons gluons w and z bosons and photons
physics photons respectively the standard model also predicts a particle known as the higgs boson the existence of which has not yet
physics yet been verified in july cern the european laboratory for particle physics announced the detection of a particle consistent with the
physics the higgs boson nuclear physics is the field of physics that studies the constituents and interactions of atomic nuclei the most
physics most commonly known applications of nuclear physics are nuclear power generation and nuclear weapons technology but the research has provided application
physics application in many fields including those in nuclear medicine and magnetic resonance imaging ion implantation in materials engineering and radiocarbon dating
physics dating in geology and archaeology astrophysics main articles astrophysics and physical cosmology the deepest visible light image of the universe the
physics the hubble ultra deep field astrophysics and astronomy are the application of the theories and methods of physics to the study

physics a broad subject astrophysicists typically apply many disciplines of physics including mechanics electromagnetism statistical mechanics thermodynamics quantum mechanics relativity nuclear and
physics and particle physics and atomic and molecular physics the discovery by karl jansky in that radio signals were emitted by celestial
physics celestial bodies initiated the science of radio astronomy most recently the frontiers of astronomy have been expanded by space exploration perturbations
physics perturbations and interference from the earth s atmosphere make space based observations necessary for infrared ultraviolet gamma ray and x ray
physics ray astronomy physical cosmology is the study of the formation and evolution of the universe on its largest scales albert einstein
physics einstein s theory of relativity plays a central role in all modern cosmological theories in the early th century hubble s
physics s discovery that the universe was expanding as shown by the hubble diagram prompted rival explanations known as the steady state
physics state universe and the big bang the big bang was confirmed by the success of big bang nucleosynthesis and the discovery
physics discovery of the cosmic microwave background in the big bang model rests on two theoretical pillars albert einstein s general relativity
physics relativity and the cosmological principle cosmologists have recently established the cdm model of the evolution of the universe which includes cosmic
physics cosmic inflation dark energy and dark matter numerous possibilities and discoveries are anticipated to emerge from new data from the fermi
physics fermi gamma ray space telescope over the upcoming decade and vastly revise or clarify existing models of the universe in particular
physics particular the potential for a tremendous discovery surrounding dark matter is possible over the next several years fermi will search for
physics for evidence that dark matter is composed of weakly interacting massive particles complementing similar experiments with the large hadron collider and
physics and other underground detectors ibex is already yielding new astrophysical discoveries no one knows what is creating the ena energetic neutral
physics neutral atoms ribbon along the termination shock of the solar wind but everyone agrees that it means the textbook picture of
physics of the heliosphere in which the solar system s enveloping pocket filled with the solar wind s charged particles is plowing
physics plowing through the onrushing galactic wind of the interstellar medium in the shape of a comet is wrong current research further
physics further information list of unsolved problems in physics feynman diagram signed by r p feynman a typical event described by physics
physics physics a magnet levitating above a superconductor demonstrates the meissner effect research in physics is continually progressing on a large number
physics number of fronts in condensed matter physics an important unsolved theoretical problem is that of high temperature superconductivity many condensed matter
physics matter experiments are aiming to fabricate workable spintronics and quantum computers in particle physics the first pieces of experimental evidence for
physics for physics beyond the standard model have begun to appear foremost among these are indications that neutrinos have non zero mass
physics mass these experimental results appear to have solved the long standing solar neutrino problem and the physics of massive neutrinos remains
physics remains an area of active theoretical and experimental research particle accelerators have begun probing energy scales in the tev range in
physics in which experimentalists are hoping to find evidence for the higgs boson and supersymmetric particles theoretical attempts to unify quantum mechanics
physics mechanics and general relativity into a single theory of quantum gravity a program ongoing for over half a century have not
physics not yet been decisively resolved the current leading candidates are m theory superstring theory and loop quantum gravity many astronomical and
physics and cosmological phenomena have yet to be satisfactorily explained including the existence of ultra high energy cosmic rays the baryon asymmetry
physics asymmetry the acceleration of the universe and the anomalous rotation rates of galaxies although much progress has been made in high
physics high energy quantum and astronomical physics many everyday phenomena involving complexity chaos or turbulence are still poorly understood citation needed complex
physics complex problems that seem like they could be solved by a clever application of dynamics and mechanics remain unsolved examples include
physics include the formation of sandpiles nodes in trickling water the shape of water droplets mechanisms of surface tension catastrophes and self
physics self sorting in shaken heterogeneous collections citation needed these complex phenomena have received growing attention since the s for several reasons
physics reasons including the availability of modern mathematical methods and computers which enabled complex systems to be modeled in new ways complex
physics complex physics has become part of increasingly interdisciplinary research as exemplified by the study of turbulence in aerodynamics and the observation
physics observation of pattern formation in biological systems in horace lamb said the researchers developed a software engine called entropica and gave
physics gave it models of a number of situations in which it could demonstrate behaviors that greatly resemble intelligence they patterned many
physics many of these exercises after classic animal intelligence tests in one test the researchers presented entropica with a situation where it
physics it could use one item as a tool to remove another item from a bin and in another it could move
physics move a cart to balance a rod standing straight up in the air governed by simple principles of thermodynamics the software
physics software responded by displaying behavior similar to what people or animals might do all without being given a specific goal for
physics for any scenario it actually self determines what its own objective is said wissner gross this artificial intelligence does not require
physics require the explicit specification of a goal unlike essentially any other artificial intelligence entropica s intelligent behavior emerges from the physical
physics physical process of trying to capture as many future histories as possible said wissner gross future histories represent the complete set
physics set of possible future outcomes available to a system at any given moment wissner gross calls the concept at the center
physics center of the research causal entropic forces these forces are the motivation for intelligent behavior they encourage a system to preserve
physics preserve as many future histories as possible for example in the cart and rod exercise entropica controls the cart to keep
physics keep the rod upright allowing the rod to fall would drastically reduce the number of remaining future histories or in other
physics other words lower the entropy of the cart and rod system keeping the rod upright maximizes the entropy it maintains all
physics all future histories that can begin from that state including those that require the cart to let the rod fall the
physics the universe exists in the present state that it has right now it can go off in lots of different directions
physics directions my proposal is that intelligence is a process that attempts to capture future histories said wissner gross the research may

religion morality abstaining from unwholesome deeds of body and speech within the division of sila are three parts of the noble eightfold
religion eightfold path right speech one speaks in a non hurtful not exaggerated truthful way samyag v c samm v c right

religion of livelihood does not harm in any way oneself or others directly or indirectly samyag j va samm j va samadhi

religion immortality and eternity the dharma the teachings or law as expounded by the buddha dharma also means the law of nature

religion practice according to therav da buddhism is the attainment of freedom from suffering which is linked with nirvana the highest spiritual
religion spiritual goal therav da teaches that the experience of suffering is caused by mental defilements like greed aversion and delusion while
religion while freedom can be attained though putting into practice teachings like the four noble truths and especially the fourth one the

religion qur an the first sura in a qur anic manuscript by hattat aziz efendi main article qur an the qur an
religion an is considered by muslims to be the literal undistorted word of god and is the central religious text of islam

religion least some portion of the qur an in the original arabic usually at least the verses needed to recite prayers those
religion those who have memorized the entire qur an are known as a hafiz muslims believe that the qur an is perfect
religion perfect only as revealed in the original arabic muslims generally believe that muhammad transmitted the revelations he received perfectly as attested
religion attested to by this verse of the qur an and if the apostle were to invent any sayings in our name
religion name we should certainly seize him by his right hand and we should certainly then cut off the artery of his

religion a hadith was originally an oral tradition relevant to the actions and customs of the islamic prophet muhammad starting from the
religion the first islamic civil war of the th century those receiving the hadith began to question the sources of the saying
religion saying citation needed verification needed this resulted in a chain of transmission for example a told me that b told him
religion him that muhammad said the hadith were eventually recorded in form with their chain of transmission recorded and were collected into
religion into large collections mostly during the reign of umar ii during th century something that solidified in the th century these
religion these works are still today referred to in matters of islamic law and history western academics view the hadith collections with
religion with caution as historical sources bernard lewis states that the collection and scrutiny of hadiths didn t take place until several
religion several generations after muhammad s death and that during that period the opportunities and motives for falsification were almost unlimited in
religion in addition to the problem of oral transmission for over a hundred years there existed motives for deliberate distortion early muslim
religion muslim scholars were also concerned that hadiths may have been fabricated and thus developed a whole science of criticism to distinguish
religion distinguish between genuine sayings and those that were errors or frauds modern historians point out that a chain of authorities may
religion may be easily forged and that rejection of some relators implies the victory of one thought over the others hadith is
religion is considered an authoritative source of revelation second only to the qur an in islamic jurisprudence the qur an contains many

religion which there are no specific qur anic rules muslims believe that they can look at the example of muhammad and his

sports sport is generally recognised as activities based in physical athleticism or physical dexterity sports are usually governed by rules to ensure
sports ensure fair competition and consistent adjudication of the winner records of performance are often kept and reported in sport news sport
sports sport is a major source of entertainment with spectator sports drawing large crowds and reaching wider audiences through sports broadcasting sport
sports sport comes from the old french desport meaning leisure with the oldest definition in english from around being anything humans find
sports find amusing or entertaining other meanings include gambling and events staged for the purpose of gambling hunting and games and diversions
sports diversions including ones that require exercise roget s defines the noun sport as an activity engaged in for relaxation and amusement
sports amusement with synonyms including diversion and recreation there are opposing views on the necessity of competition as a defining element of
sports of a sport with almost all professional sport involving competition and governing bodies requiring competition as a prerequisite of recognition by
sports by the international olympic committee ioc or sportaccord other bodies advocate widening the definition of sport to include all physical activity
sports activity for instance the council of europe include all forms of physical exercise including those completed just for fun in order
sports order to widen participation and reduce the impact of losing on less able participants there has been an introduction of non
sports non competitive physical activity to traditionally competitive events such as school sports days although moves like this are often controversial there
sports there are artifacts and structures that suggest that the chinese engaged in sporting activities as early as bc gymnastics appears to
sports to have been a popular sport in china s ancient past monuments to the pharaohs indicate that a number of sports
sports sports including swimming and fishing were well developed and regulated several thousands of years ago in ancient egypt other egyptian sports
sports sports included javelin throwing high jump and wrestling ancient persian sports such as the traditional iranian martial art of zourkhaneh had
sports had a close connection to the warfare skills among other sports that originate in ancient persia are polo and jousting motorized
sports motorized sports have appeared since the advent of the modern age a wide range of sports were already established by the
sports the time of ancient greece and the military culture and the development of sports in greece influenced one another considerably sports
sports sports became such a prominent part of their culture that the greeks created the olympic games which in ancient times were
sports were held every four years in a small village in the peloponnesus called olympia sports have been increasingly organised and regulated
sports regulated from the time of the ancient olympics up to the present century industrialisation has brought increased leisure time to the
sports the citizens of developed and developing countries leading to more time for citizens to attend and spectator sports greater participation in
sports in athletic activities and increased accessibility these trends continued with the advent of mass media and global communication professionalism became prevalent
sports prevalent further adding to the increase in sport s popularity as sports fans began ing the exploits of professional athletes through
sports through radio television and the internet all while enjoying the exercise and competition associated with amateur participation in sports sportsmanship is
sports is an attitude that strives for fair play courtesy toward teammates and opponents ethical behaviour and integrity and grace in victory
sports victory or defeat sportsmanship expresses an aspiration or ethos that the activity will be enjoyed for its own sake the well
sports well known sentiment by sports journalist grantland rice that it s not that you won or lost but how you played
sports played the game and the modern olympic creed expressed by its founder pierre de coubertin the most important thing is not
sports not winning but taking part are typical expressions of this sentiment the competitive nature of sport encourages some participants to attempt
sports attempt to enhance their performance through the use of medicines or through other means such as increasing the volume of blood
sports blood in their bodies through artificial means all sports recognised by the ioc or sportaccord are required to implement a testing
sports testing programme looking for a list of banned drugs with suspensions or bans being placed on participants who test positive for
sports for banned substances sport can be undertaken on an amateur professional or semi professional basis depending on whether particpants are incentivised
sports incentivised for participation usually through payment of a wage or salary the popularity of spectator sport as a recreation for non
sports non participants has led to sport becoming a major business in its own right and this has incentivised a high paying
sports paying professional sport culture where high performing participants are rewarded with pay far in excess of average wages which can run
sports run into millions of dollars some sports or individual competitions within a sport retain a policy of allowing only amateur sport
sports sport the olympic games started with a principle of amateur competition with those who practiced a sport professionally considered to have
sports have an unfair advantage over those who practiced it merely as a hobby ing the games the ioc decided to make
sports make all professional athletes eligible for the olympics with only boxing and wrestling still competed on an amateur basis although this
sports this revolves around rules and not payment alpine skiers american football players archers athletes badminton players list of high school baseball

sports baseball is a bat and ball game played between two teams of nine players each who take turns batting and fielding
sports fielding the batting team attempts to score runs by hitting a ball that is thrown by the pitcher with a bat
sports bat swung by the batter then running counter clockwise around a series of four bases first second third and home plate
sports plate a run is scored when a player advances around the bases and returns to home plate players on the batting
sports batting team take turns hitting against the pitcher of the fielding team which tries to prevent runs by getting hitters out
sports out in any of several ways a player on the batting team who reaches a base safely can later attempt to
sports to advance to subsequent bases during teammates turns batting such as on a hit or by other means the teams switch
sports switch between batting and fielding whenever the fielding team records three outs one turn batting for both teams beginning with the
sports the visiting team constitutes an inning a game comprises nine innings and the team with the greater number of runs at
sports at the end of the game wins baseball is the only major team sport in america with no game clock although
sports although almost all games end in the ninth inning evolving from older bat and ball games an early form of baseball
sports baseball was being played in england by the mid th century this game was brought by immigrants to north america where
sports where the modern version developed by the late th century baseball was widely recognized as the national sport of the united
sports united states baseball is now popular in north america and parts of central and south america the caribbean and east asia
sports asia in the united states and canada professional major league baseball mlb teams are divided into the national league nl and
sports and american league al each with three divisions east west and central the major league champion is determined by playoffs that
sports that culminate in the world series the top level of play is similarly split in japan between the central and pacific
sports association football more commonly known as football or soccer is a sport played between two teams of eleven players with a
sports a spherical ball it is played by million players in over nations making it the world s most popular sport the
sports the game is played on a rectangular field with a goal at each end the object of the game is to
sports to score by getting the ball into the opposing goal the goalkeepers are the only players allowed to touch the ball
sports ball with their hands or arms while it is in play and only in their penalty area outfield players mostly use
sports use their feet to strike or pass the ball but may also use their head or torso to do so instead
sports instead the team that scores the most goals by the end of the match wins if the score is level at
sports at the end of the game either a draw is declared or the game goes into extra time and or a
sports a penalty shootout depending on the format of the competition the laws of the game were originally codified in england by
sports by the football association in association football is governed internationally by the international federation of association football fifa french f d
